story:
Three years ago my husband and I adopted a beautiful little four month old baby boy.  We already had his half sister and were so excited to have them raised together, as siblings should be.  It wasn't very long before we noticed our little boy was having difficulty.  He would scream and tantrum over very little and would become physically aggressive without provocation.  His speech was (and is) delayed and he showed no fear for physical harm during play.  He also has no fear of strangers, walking up and hugging just about anyone. Josh had eating difficulties that were bad enough to require occupational therapy.

In December Josh was diagnosed with Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder and he also has Sensory Processing Issues.  If you can imagine trying to navigate your life  with your brain functioning similar to one who is drunk, just without the buzz and all sensory input on full blast.  Josh has trouble making decisions, modifying his behavior, dealing with sensory input and does not cope with transitions well at all.  He has many "meltdowns" a day and needs my husband and I to help regulate his world.

The reason for fundraising...Josh has been approved for a service dog!!  The dog will help him navigate his world, will be attuned to his emotional state and will help him calm down if over stimulated or frustrated.  The dog can help with stranger intervention to keep him safe and also go to school with him to help him transition throughout his day.  The dog is $13,000.00 and as a family we cannot afford this on our own.  We are looking for help to provide our son with the best future possible.  The impact this dog will have for Josh is priceless.  He will be able to have some independence from Steve and I, to have the chance to learn a new way to live in his world and to have what others take for granted...friends.   

Thank you so much for your donation, it means the world to Josh...and his loving family!
story_txt:
Three years ago my husband and I adopted a beautiful little four month old baby boy.  We already had his half sister and were so excited to have them raised together, as siblings should be.  It wasn't very long before we noticed our little boy was having difficulty.  He would scream and tantrum over very little and would become physically aggressive without provocation.  His speech was (and is) delayed and he showed no fear for physical harm during play.  He also has no fear of strangers, walking up and hugging just about anyone. Josh had eating difficulties that were bad enough to require occupational therapy.
In December Josh was diagnosed with Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder and he also has Sensory Processing Issues.  If you can imagine trying to navigate your life  with your brain functioning similar to one who is drunk, just without the buzz and all sensory input on full blast.  Josh has trouble making decisions, modifying his behavior, dealing with sensory input and does not cope with transitions well at all.  He has many "meltdowns" a day and needs my husband and I to help regulate his world.
The reason for fundraising...Josh has been approved for a service dog!!  The dog will help him navigate his world, will be attuned to his emotional state and will help him calm down if over stimulated or frustrated.  The dog can help with stranger intervention to keep him safe and also go to school with him to help him transition throughout his day.  The dog is $13,000.00 and as a family we cannot afford this on our own.  We are looking for help to provide our son with the best future possible.  The impact this dog will have for Josh is priceless.  He will be able to have some independence from Steve and I, to have the chance to learn a new way to live in his world and to have what others take for granted...friends.   


Thank you so much for your donation, it means the world to Josh...and his loving family!

story:
Qbyq is asking for your generosity in helping us purchase materials to begin production of


Pointless Chores Are More Pleasurable Than Burdens by writer and poet Suzahn Ebrahimian.

Artwork by Lily Rossebo

Printed by Qbyq

Art books/ Poetry

4.5” x 4”

Edition of 111


This book’s design was inspired by the symbolic and intimate moment of putting on jewelry. The eight stanza poem is strung together on eight pages in this accordion style book. At its ends are the pieces to a gold clasp that also function to hold the book together.


Variation of drawing by Lily Rossebo to be printed behind the poem in accordion fold


_

About Suzahn

I write poems unprofessionally, with a passion. I like to write with no boundaries between subjects - or, better yet, I like to write in the liminal spaces between people (spaces that become relationships, actions, and connections). My voice is a constantly developing power, as is yours. 


In my other lives, I like to teach about anti-oppression, mutual aid, direct action, education, and collectivism. Sometimes I do this as a “job,” though mostly I do it because I like to and brings me closer to the people around me. I also have spent much time dedicated to studying ancient Greek Tragedy, and draw much inspiration from the power of those texts.

So far, my poetry has appeared in online publications such as Otis Nebula and Broad! magazine. To read my published and some self-published poetry, you can go to my website at youmightybee.tumblr.com and poke around there. Lately I've been forgoing submitting to lit journals because I prefer working more intimately on publishing projects, like with Christine and Lily. It feels much more empowering to be able to work with fellow artists who have skills and passions that are in different realms - all to create something beautiful together.

_

About Lily

Lily Rossebo is an artist and researcher, interested in projects that respond to place and community. While she is currently living and working in New York, Lily is interested in exploring the borders of the United States and has recently lived in Mexico, Canada and the United Kingdom.

Lily is a recent graduate of ‘Art, Space + Nature’ (ASN), a post-graduate program at Edinburgh College of Art. The program encourages students to professionally integrate research, creative practice and contemporary cultural theory, through various lectures, seminars, workshops and field studies.

This past winter Lily participated in Mass// Public Space// Response, a workshop at the Berlin University of the Arts (UdK), which brought twenty-three participants together to observe, interact and intervene in unfamiliar public spaces. The workshop resulted in an exhibition at the UdK and is soon to produce a publication.

_

About Qbyq

Qbyq is a limited editions printer and bookmaking project run by Christine Rucker. Qbyq began as a simple operation in making handmade books during her working hours at NY Central. Two years later Qbyq products are still handmade by Christine. She purchases materials that are green, biodegradable, and made by relatively small manufacturers that are absolutely awesome. Qbyq has produced custom books for individuals and organizations. http://Qbyq.info

_

We are hoping to raise $338.76 *not $500*. After fees all surplus belongs to the author.

Budget,

$ 118.77 gold clasps

$ 32.77 Lana Ingres black

$ 42.75 Murillo Black

$ 20.00 2 screens

$ 15.00 White Ink

$ 19.5 Screenprinting Services

$ 12.00 Silk thread

$ 50.00 Shipping and Taxes

($ 27.97) Charged paid to Indiegogo

story:
I am heading to Salt Lake City to cover the 2014 American Atheist Convention. Only problem is I don’t have the money to get there! I have a ticket to the convention, and access to cover all of it and interview some of the biggest names in atheism and secularism.

I have done the math, checked the prices and I can get there and secure lodging at the event for $800. As a freelance writer, I do not make a lot of money and often volunteer my work to great secular organizations and I do not want to put this travel burden on my family.

So I am appealing to you, the readers who have said they enjoy my writing, to help get me there. Any amount you can donate to help make this happen would mean I will have a chance to bring you a first hand account of all the conventions happenings through, live blogging, full length articles and live tweets during conference events.

If you can afford to donate over $75, I will personally send you a signed copy of my upcoming book tentatively titled, “Parenting Without God”, out later this year on Dangerous Little Books!

Donations of $10 or more will receive of a personal thank you from me on my next appearance on Atheist Hangouts.

My articles will appear on American Atheist, Richard Dawkins Foundation and Huffington Post. Meaning that all the topics discussed, all of the important issues facing a secular America will be read by millions of people worldwide, spreading our cause even further and keeping those unable to attend the conference informed on what is happening in our movement today.

I want to thank each and every one of you, regardless of if you can donate or not. Taking the time to read this and all the great feedback I get from my work means more than I can ever properly express to you.

story:
What is The African American Folklorist?

The African American Folklorist is a quarterly Newspaper that contains articles about traditions, traditional beliefs, the cultural context, geographical locations, music, and vernaculars of African Americans and the role each element plays in the lives of the people past and present. AAF furthers the mission of Jack Dappa Blues Heritage Preservation by publishing articles that discuss the evolution of our traditions, and that present research about blues people. We include interviews with and articles from musicians, historians, ethnographers, Community Scholars, and academics who specialize in and are enthusiastic about the Black Experience in America. AAF includes a variety of perspectives on the black experience and seeks to educate and share perspectives with people of all colors.  We also are proud to incorporate youth that show interest in studying, researching, and preserving our heritage. There is an entire section dedicated to them called the "African American Folklorist Kids & Youth Section," which publishes articles and research papers from young people aged 10-17.​

What We Need & What You Get

  1. Our initial campaign raised $2000! https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/the-african-...
  2. Now we are raising the remaining balance and need your help!
  • By contributing to The AAF you will:
  • help catapult a significant publication from the ground up 
  • receive some cool perks that include but aren't limited to special thank you videos, year-long subscriptions, shout-outs in upcoming issues and more.

 

IMPACT 

  • Currently The African American Folklorist contributing writers  and columnists are volunteering their time and content. With your help, we can pay stipends. 
  • Your donation will allow us to expand our reach within and outside of the United States.

Risks & Challenges

  • $5,000 will help us get going, but it won't last forever.
  • Our ultimate goal for The African American Folklorist is to develop enough revenue from partnerships with local and national vendors via sponsored advertising, content creation, and monthly publication.
  • We need to continue printing our product, attract a bigger following, and develop our reputation. We'll be using this campaign to help potential sponsors and advertisers see why they should be part of The African American Folklorist.

Other Ways You Can Help

If money is tight...

  • Reach out to us about being a contributing writer!
  • Spread the word by sharing our campaign with people who might be interested in helping us make our goal, or even take it further.
  • Subscribe, SHARE, COMMENT!

Who are the founders?

Lamont Jack Pearley - FOUNDER/PUBLISHER/EDITOR

As an NYC-born descendant of the Great Migration, Lamont's life changed dramatically in the mid-2000s when he returned to Louisiana and Mississippi to bury close relatives. Returning to those regions and their deep associations with Blues history, he felt the urgency to raise cultural and ethnic awareness of African American Traditional Music as it pertains to the Black Experience in America. Over the last 12 years, Lamont's work documenting African American vernacular narratives, music, and cultures resulted in an extensive collection of field interviews with historians, documentarians, blues and folk musicians, and the children of Black music legends. This body of work earned him an induction into the New York Blues Hall of Fame as Great Blues Historian and TV/Radio Producer (2017) and Great Blues Artist (2018).

Denise Pearley - CO-FOUNDER/PROJECT MANAGER

Coming from a background in restaurant management with a degree in Digital Film and Multi-Media and now an entrepreneur, Denise has applied those skills to the production of Jack Dappa Blues Public Media content, as well as a healthy plant-based cooking regimen that heightens the energy necessary for the team to work full-throttle on programming and projects that resonate with the African American Folklorist Newspaper audience.

Contributing Writers

Virginia Jimenez - Virginia is a performing arts educator and writer. She’s a co-director for Blues Dance New York, where she invests in her love of blues music and blues dance in order to share it with others. You can find examples of her work at her website.

Michael Jones - Michael is an author and journalist whose research and writing reclaims the African American Traditions and music popularized in Kentucky and traveled the world. Notably, his work includes the book Louisville Jug Music, and co-curating Celebrating the Sounds of Kentucky.  Listen to him is this episode of Jack Dappa Blues Podcast.

Nascha A. Joli - Nascha is an African-American author from Harlem in New York City. She has released her debut novel, Smoke Gets In Your Eyes. In addition to writing literature, Nascha also writes plays and screenplays. Nascha can also be found online at www.naschajoli.com.

Doug Curry - “Black & Blues Correspondent” is the host of BLACKS & BLUES since 1982, airing Friday’s 9 pm-midnight EST at www.wrur.org, and Saturday’s 10-11 pm CST at www.wdcb.org.”

Courtland W. Hankins, III - The President of Hip Hop is a music producer, activist, and teacher.

Karleton Thomas - Karleton Thomas is a business professional with extensive experience in retail, eCommerce, apparel manufacturing, and social enterprises. He previously was the chief operating officer at LocalLux, a high-end boutique marketplace, and a sales director for an Alexandria, Va. based tech company.

Chief Elwin Warhorse Gillum - Queen of Tchefuncta Nation and the Chief of the Chahta Tribe. As appointed by the 365 Elders (Blood Members) of the Tribe, she was appointed the Chief of the Tribe in 1998 and took the throne of the Nation in 2009.

Columnists

Corey Harris - Guitarist, Songwriter, Singer, Performer and Revolutionary, Corey Harris is a current Black Traditional Music Practitioner. Corey Harris has earned substantial critical acclaim as one of the few contemporary bluesmen able to channel the raw, direct emotion of acoustic Delta blues without coming off as an authenticity-obsessed historian. He's also a Graduate Teaching Assistant at the University of Virginia, prophet at E.A.B.I.C, and Founder/CEO/Owner at Nattyworks.

Doug Curry - “Black & Blues Correspondent” is the host of BLACKS & BLUES since 1982, airing Friday’s 9 pm-midnight EST at www.wrur.org, and Saturday’s 10-11 pm CST at www.wdcb.org.”

Kids and Youth Section Columnists

Lamont Pearley Jr. - Lamont Pearley Jr. is a 13 years old columnist for the African American Folklorist newspaper kids section. He is a coder and gamer that records and edits his own videos.  Lamont enjoys drawing and having fun with his family, all while working to uplift and encourage all those he encounters. 

Gideon Wiesen  - A native New Yorker from Inwood, 10-year-old Gideon Wiesen loves to use his imagination and needs to listen to music constantly when he works. He's inspired by the graphic novels he reads and loves dogs, especially his pitbull, Sheridan, who proofreads all his work.

Samara Pearley - Samara Pearley is a young columnist for the African American folklorist kids section. She is a student of arts and culture currently learning to play the piano while working with her vocal/acting coach. She writes songs and poems, and love llamas and alpacas. Samara thinks llamas are cute and has two stuffed llamas named q.t. and j.t.! Samara loves singing and acting!

Dhane Pearley - Dhane Pearley is a 17-year-old columnist for the African American Folklorist newspaper. He is a student-athlete that attends the Winchendon School. Dhane was given the nickname of Bam Bam when he was small because he was much stronger than the other kids. Bam Bam enjoys listening to music, hanging out with his big brother and his friends, and fashion. Dhane is a young entrepreneur who runs a clothing business called Change The Game with his older brother “Shane”.

story:
This book is about different approaches to support individuals with food allergies. I wrote it because I want people to gain a better understanding about what it is like to live with food allergies and essentially, how to help those who are living with them. My book will publish in April, 2020. 

Story of My Book

When Food Can Kill You — My book presents many different types of obstacles that people with food allergies face every day. It explores a variety of potential solutions and strategies for addressing these obstacles more effectively. It examines considerable factors influencing both positive and negative outlooks on individuals with food allergies, as well as specialty food items. It also educates those who are unaware about food allergies on how to deal with them in various situations. 

My name is Gabrielle Zimmerman and I am the author of When Food Can Kill You. I wrote this book because I wanted to explore a variety of elements that make food allergies complex and often misunderstood. I realized that people are not always intentionally discriminatory towards those living with food allergies, but just don’t have a framework on how to deal with it in everyday situations.  

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will gain a better understanding about what it is like to live with food allergies and to discover new ways to support those around you who have them. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for spreading food allergy awareness. And then ultimately, I want you to see this book as a guide for knowing how to deal with food allergies on a daily basis. 

In this book, you'll learn about the impact of evolving foodways on consumers' behaviors towards food allergies and specialty food items in the marketplace. You’ll learn about my own personal journey with celiac disease and food allergies. You’ll also be exposed to multiple ways in which food allergies are presented in various contexts:

  • How food industry innovations and trends have impacted the food allergy community both positively and negatively. 
  • What my life was like both before and after my diagnoses with celiac disease and food allergies.
  • Two unaccompanied teenagers trying to fly back to school were kicked off a connecting international flight in Seoul, South Korea for a nut allergy. Korean airlines refused to refrain from serving peanuts on the flight, which left the boys no other choice but to fly back to Atlanta where they started. 
  • What started out as an innocent request for me to share a dessert with him, quickly escalated into his relentless insistence that my symptoms were all "in my head."​

You will love this book if you crave new insights about food allergies and want to engage in different strategies that can be both helpful to you or to someone with food allergies. If you’re looking for guidance on how to treat food allergies, then this is the book for you! For anyone passionate about nutrition or anything food-related, as well as working in this type of field, this book is certainly a great read for you too! 

When Food Can Kill You is a non-fiction book that speaks to those living with, or without food allergies, offering guidance on how to manage them and exercise appropriate precautions for dealing with them. It provides unique input on the apparent increase of consumer acceptance towards specialized food items in the marketplace, while considering how this has both positively and negatively impacted the food allergy community. It also addresses different types of human behavior towards individuals with food allergies.

 

The Book - When Food Can Kill You

The book is written in 2 Parts…so far...

Part 1 contains the introduction + additional chapters. The reader will learn about the fundamental drivers of change in the food industry, how this transformation has come to redefine our perspectives about food in general, and how this has ultimately shifted conventional thinking about food allergies and specialty food items in the marketplace. 

  • The claim that the Gluten-Free diet is “healthier” for you has been a two-sided coin for people with gluten allergies or intolerances, or for those diagnosed with celiac disease.​
  • Rising concerns over the safety of today’s foods leads to new consumer purchasing behaviors and demands. ​

Part 2 contains Chapters 1-9. The reader will learn about key differences between certain medical terms, what my life was like before and after my diagnosis with celiac disease and multiple food allergies, how food allergies play out in six different contexts, and useful tactics that can be implemented into various food allergy situations.  

  • Understanding the difference between a food allergy and a food intolerance, or sensitivity
  • Understanding the difference between celiac disease and a gluten allergy
  • Going from an all-time high to an all-time low: singing “America The Beautiful” at the US Tennis Open and in the same month getting severely sick, leading to a diagnosis with celiac disease a year later and multiple food allergies four and a half years later. 
  • Ex-Noma Chef, Founder of the school lunch program,“Brigaid,” provides some input on certain complications that can arise when dealing with students who have special dietary needs
  • Learning about school lunch budgets and how that translates to providing special meal options for those with food allergies and/or intolerances, or those diagnosed with celiac disease. 

​

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter.

 

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Gabrielle Zimmerman is a student at New York University, passionately studying Nutrition and Dietetics. Her goal is to obtain a Dietetic Internship and ultimately become a Registered Dietitian. Her dream is to work with patients with food allergies, including athletes and/or performers, and children. You can find her exploring different gluten-free restaurants in the city, trying all kinds of fitness classes, studying at the library, and going to singing lessons twice a week. She loves meeting new people and is always open-minded to hearing new ideas. She is motivated, hard-working and dedicated and always gives her 110% to everything she does.

Dealing with celiac disease and multiple food allergies has always felt like walking into a dark room, bumping into and becoming familiar with the objects in it, and then hopefully finding a light-switch to be able to see everything. Indubitably, it has been an endless tide of learning and discovery.

With uncertainty comes fear and with a lack of understanding comes frustration. This brings me to the point that knowledge is one of the greatest gifts and powers that we can give to ourselves and thus, to others.

I decided to write this book because I want to increase awareness about the importance of accommodating food allergies, as far as in schools, colleges, restaurants, and so forth. I want people to learn from my life's experiences as well as from some others in hopes that we can work together to improve the quality of life for those with all kinds of special dietary needs. 

"For the amount that food costs me everyday, I might as well hire my own chef."


For more information you can connect with Gabrielle at gz592@nyu.edu and LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/gabrielle-zimmerman-5a31a911a/ | IG: gabbyrose4 | 

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #FoodCanKill tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

 

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!
Gabrielle Zimmerman
story_txt:
This book is about different approaches to support individuals with food allergies. I wrote it because I want people to gain a better understanding about what it is like to live with food allergies and essentially, how to help those who are living with them. My book will publish in April, 2020. 
Story of My Book
When Food Can Kill You — My book presents many different types of obstacles that people with food allergies face every day. It explores a variety of potential solutions and strategies for addressing these obstacles more effectively. It examines considerable factors influencing both positive and negative outlooks on individuals with food allergies, as well as specialty food items. It also educates those who are unaware about food allergies on how to deal with them in various situations. My name is Gabrielle Zimmerman and I am the author of When Food Can Kill You. I wrote this book because I wanted to explore a variety of elements that make food allergies complex and often misunderstood. I realized that people are not always intentionally discriminatory towards those living with food allergies, but just don’t have a framework on how to deal with it in everyday situations.  My hope is that, in reading this book, you will gain a better understanding about what it is like to live with food allergies and to discover new ways to support those around you who have them. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for spreading food allergy awareness. And then ultimately, I want you to see this book as a guide for knowing how to deal with food allergies on a daily basis. In this book, you'll learn about the impact of evolving foodways on consumers' behaviors towards food allergies and specialty food items in the marketplace. You’ll learn about my own personal journey with celiac disease and food allergies. You’ll also be exposed to multiple ways in which food allergies are presented in various contexts:

How food industry innovations and trends have impacted the food allergy community both positively and negatively. 
What my life was like both before and after my diagnoses with celiac disease and food allergies.
Two unaccompanied teenagers trying to fly back to school were kicked off a connecting international flight in Seoul, South Korea for a nut allergy. Korean airlines refused to refrain from serving peanuts on the flight, which left the boys no other choice but to fly back to Atlanta where they started. 

What started out as an innocent request for me to share a dessert with him, quickly escalated into his relentless insistence that my symptoms were all "in my head."​


You will love this book if you crave new insights about food allergies and want to engage in different strategies that can be both helpful to you or to someone with food allergies. If you’re looking for guidance on how to treat food allergies, then this is the book for you! For anyone passionate about nutrition or anything food-related, as well as working in this type of field, this book is certainly a great read for you too! When Food Can Kill You is a non-fiction book that speaks to those living with, or without food allergies, offering guidance on how to manage them and exercise appropriate precautions for dealing with them. It provides unique input on the apparent increase of consumer acceptance towards specialized food items in the marketplace, while considering how this has both positively and negatively impacted the food allergy community. It also addresses different types of human behavior towards individuals with food allergies.
 
The Book - When Food Can Kill You
The book is written in 2 Parts…so far...Part 1 contains the introduction + additional chapters. The reader will learn about the fundamental drivers of change in the food industry, how this transformation has come to redefine our perspectives about food in general, and how this has ultimately shifted conventional thinking about food allergies and specialty food items in the marketplace. 


The claim that the Gluten-Free diet is “healthier” for you has been a two-sided coin for people with gluten allergies or intolerances, or for those diagnosed with celiac disease.​


Rising concerns over the safety of today’s foods leads to new consumer purchasing behaviors and demands. ​


Part 2 contains Chapters 1-9. The reader will learn about key differences between certain medical terms, what my life was like before and after my diagnosis with celiac disease and multiple food allergies, how food allergies play out in six different contexts, and useful tactics that can be implemented into various food allergy situations.  

Understanding the difference between a food allergy and a food intolerance, or sensitivity
Understanding the difference between celiac disease and a gluten allergy
Going from an all-time high to an all-time low: singing “America The Beautiful” at the US Tennis Open and in the same month getting severely sick, leading to a diagnosis with celiac disease a year later and multiple food allergies four and a half years later. 
Ex-Noma Chef, Founder of the school lunch program,“Brigaid,” provides some input on certain complications that can arise when dealing with students who have special dietary needs
Learning about school lunch budgets and how that translates to providing special meal options for those with food allergies and/or intolerances, or those diagnosed with celiac disease. 

​

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2020

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter.

 
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
And more...

story:
What if all your favorite horror writers, artists and creators could come together around the campfire to share their spookiest, creepiest yarns? At @Midnight_Pals, you get an inside look at just such a hypothetical gathering: From Stephen King's dad jokes to H.P. Lovecraft's unfortunately named cat, no aspect of the horror business remains unskewered when these horror maestros -- and some not-so-maestros -- get together!

What do the experts think about the Midnight Pals? 

“Oh my God, this is pretty funny!” - Brian Keene, Earthworm Gods, Dark Hollow

"I was one of the authors included in the Midnight Society tweets.  Those tweets were unfair, oversimplified my interests, and stung my pride.  I'm pretty sure that means this is genius." - Richard Roberts, Wild Children, Quite Contrary

"HUGE NEVER-ENDING ENDORSEMENT.  Best entertainment thread in Twitter history!"  - Gail Simone, Birds of Prey, Secret Six, Deadpool, Wonder Woman

The @midnight_pals Twitter account has lampooned everyone from Thomas Ligotti to Junji Ito and now we want to collect ALL the best, funniest tweets into one big, solid, physical grimoire that you can put on your shelf in your own personal library and possibly rig up so that when you pull it off the shelf, the shelf spins around to reveal a secret passage to an underground laboratory or forgotten crypt. That's up to you.  But we want to provide you with the perfect book to use as the linchpin of that scenario. Something you can enjoy at home with your own cult or coven!

"Submitted for the Approval of the Midnight Pals" will be 80+ pages of non-stop hilarity, assembling every tweet currently posted at @midnight_pals for easy reference with much, more more -- including morbidly fantastic illustrations by David Mumford and an introduction by 2014 World Horror Grandmaster Award and double Bram Stoker Award winner Brian Keene (author of Earthworm Gods, The Complex, and Dark Hollow)!

Mary Shelley, HP Lovecraft, Edgar Allen Poe and Junji Ito as imagined by our artist David Mumford!

"Okay, these illustrations look pretty amazing," you say, "And I can't wait to hear Brian Keene's thoughts... but... these are tweets? Couldn't I just, like, read them online for free?"

Okay, yes, TECHNICALLY, you could. That's why we're going out of our way to include big loads of bonus content to sweeten the deal. Let's review all the extra stuff you'll be getting...

  • Wacky, funny listicles like Thomas Ligotti's Top 5 Seasonal Festivals and H.P. Lovecraft's Top 5 Slurs for Non-New Englanders!
  • Fake ads spoofing the classic inserts from 1980s pulp horror paperbacks!
  • Some of @Midnight_Pals author Bitter Karella's personal thoughts on the horror genre, since you're all obviously very interested in that!
  • The @Midnight_Pals tweets reveal the backstage banter between authors around the fire, but the book will also include some of the "actual" stories they tell as well. That's right, enjoy some stories spoofing the styles of Clive Barker, Stephen King, Dean Koontz, and more! 

And, of course, the main attraction...

The COMPLETE tweets of @Midnight_pals!

Go ahead and back our book... if you dare! 

It only takes a sponsorship of a mere $5 to get your hands on a deliciously decadent e-book PDF version of 'Submitted for the Approval of the Midnight Pals' and a mere $10 to ensure that your name will live on in infamy as a sponsor of highest caliber. But surely what you most desire is the tome itself, the truest, purest physical book version! And, to get that, tis a mere $20 sponsorship.  Or $25 if you want it signed by the scribe herself.  Is that all?  Of course not!  At higher levels, you can even get extra goodies...

 Have ideas about a particular horror creator that you'd like to see receive the Midnight Pals treatment? You can designate a victim of your choice to be skewered in up to a full page of new tweets for a mere $100 sponsorship. And if you'd like to see a full short story written in the style of your favorite (or least favorite) creator? We've got an option for that too, at the $200 sponsorship level! 

But that's not all... why not go for the gusto? Why not live dangerously? Because one lucky sponor will have the opportunity to have the ultimate donor experience, Le Grand Guignol! For $500, you get ALL the perks from the lower tiers plus... a cameo in an upcoming book by Horror Grandmaster Brian Keene! That's right, Brian will write you into one of his damnably dark tales... and have you slaughtered in the most delectable way! You won't want to miss this rare opportunity for horror fiction immortality!

Don't delay another second! Please join us in making this book a reality... and making all your horror dreams... or, as we call them, nightmares... come true!

Bitter Karella posts @midnight_pals tweets, which are whispered in dreams by haunted ventriloquist dummy Junior

Bitter Karella (@bitterkarella) is the writer and horror aficionado behind @Midnight_pals. She's been involved with two successful book Kickstarters in the past, Misunderstanding Comics and Firebrat: The True Meaning of Christmas. She lives in a hut on fowl’s legs in the dark of the deep woods and can be summoned by the sacrifice of a white cockerel on the eve of a new moon. 

The bulk of the book is already completed -- 90% written, illustrated, and ready to go! Bitter Karella has experience working with printers -- having already self-published the graphic novel Misunderstanding Comics and various zines -- and has already selected a capable printer with whom she has a long-standing relationship and who she is confident is up to the task! All she needs to start the process is a little bit of help from you, the esteemed backers! In fact, I would say that the biggest risk in this process is that, well, there's some infinitesimally small chance that your book might get lost in the mail on its way to you, I suppose. But if you can't trust the postal system who can you trust?

story:
THANK  YOU ALL SO VERY  MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT AND CONTRIBUTIONS.

Thank you is such a small word but I know that you all know how much I appreciate your love, friendship, encouragement and donations. 

I shall be contacting you all shortly - and will be sending you the first of your gifts from us.

I  would love you to follow our story - yours and mine  here . www.theparfaitparty.com

If you  have a friend or company who would like to donate or become sponsors please direct them to this page https://parfaitparty.wordpress.com/rewards/

ONCE AGAIN THANK YOU, EACH AND EVERY ONE OF YOU ARE BEAUTIFUL PEOPLE WITH THE KINDEST OF HEARTS :)

Warm hugs from Vanessa 

Vanessa@theparfaitparty.com

 

 

Stage iv Breast Cancer v Parfait!

 Stage IV Breast Cancer may mean a lot less time to live but I have big plans, and they begin here ...

A) Buy a cutlery and parfait set (get back Cancer, I got things to do, parties to host)
B) Exchange my comfy home for a mobile home and start an indefinite road trip - fundraise via indiegogo - please donate today.
C) Write a series of books to inspire everyone to live life to the max ( at least the first issue anyway )
D) Hold fun raising events for local charities as I travel - I want to give back to local communities they are the lifeblood of any nation
E) Party! Party! Party! I may not ahve long  but it is going to be fun :)

   

What if you get too ill or... err, ahem … well, you know... before the first book is published? 

 1) I don't intend to “err, ahem … well, you know” just yet. Statistics say 2% of people with this advanced/secondary/stage iv breast cancer live for many years. I INTEND being in that 2%! The other 98% survive between 3 and 5 years and I've used nearly  one of those years already.

 2) I have a great team who have helped me put this amazing adventure together. A member of my team will continue the trip and make sure every reward is delivered and the first book is published :) We've also got volunteer drivers in case I get too borked to drive long distances. Even if I need to pull up for treatments, the show will go on – Parfait Party Events will still be held and I'll skype in to anything I can't attend in person.

 Every single sponsor gets ALL this!

Absolutely EVERYONE who contributes will become a member of my virtual road trip and in addition to the rewards at your chosen level,  you'll also get:

1) an e-copy of the first inspirational book - "That's Awesome!"

2) an e-copy of the Parfait Party recipe book

3) you'll also get a twitter and blog shout out

4) listed on my website as a road trip team member

5) warm hugs and smiles

6) exclusive login to the bloopers/outtakes and other information

7) a souvenir screensaver at the end of the trip

8) the opportunity to purchase the book 'That's Awesome!' volume 1 at cost

9) your sponsorship acknowledged in any publication or video  produced

 BONUS: For this last 24 hours there is a special bonus for EVERYONE.  Each donor  will get a special electronic arts bundle put together by my very talented and generous arts team.  There is music, e-books, self development tools... it's an amazing showbag of e-goodies.  This goodie bag includes:

 1) ebooks for the children in your life by children's author  Micki Zee

The Drawing Club -  Book #1 Harrietts Golden Pen

The Kings of Nu - Book #! Seeing Red At Norah Head

http://www.mickizee.com/

 2) A Parfait Party mp3 unplugged from singer/songwriter David Llewellyn aka Bright Oh

Parfait Party collection vol 1 - The Sunflower  

Parfait Party collection vol 2 - Into My Arms

Parfait Party collection vol 3 - The Flame and the Arrow

http://brightoh.com

 3) Online membership and ebook for Richard Geer's Star Journey method

Do you often make choices because they clearly seemed like the right thing to do at the time, though there seem to be no words to express why?

Star Journey helps you understand the principle of synchronicity and shows how to tap innate intuition.  Make decisions, sdolve problems, explore relationships.

http://star-journey.com/

  

What will the indiegogo funds be used for? 

We need to get mobile! The Parfait Party needs funds to purchase a reliable motorhome/caravan for the road trip and pay some travelling costs.   I'm putting all my resources into this one last adventure, but I don't have quite enough to cover the whole lot.   

 

Interview with Vanessa

You're doing what exactly? 

The Parfait Party is an epic road trip, dotted with fun-filled Parfait Parties, with the aims of celebrating and publishing awesome true stories and fund-raising for local communities on the way. 

I want to live the rest of my life to the fullest and leave something to inspire others to do the same. I'm going to be roadtripping for as long as possible, hunting out people and stories that just make you go "Wow, That's Awesome!"  My blog and book will capture the spirit of fearless living. 

On the way, I'll host fund-raising Parfait Party Events around the country to honour inspirational people and stories and the funds raised will go to a local charity or organisation chosen by the  awesome person. 

 

The Road Trip sounds fun, can I come too? 

For some of the perks (over $3000) I'll pull over and open the passenger door.  Join me for a week on the road. (6 opportunities only).  

What can we do to help? 

1) Pass my story along on Facebook, Twitter, email, in person, carrier pigeon - whatever communication you have at your disposal - keep passing the story forward. 

2) Choose a perk or donate.  Money is awesome, but if you think you have a useful product or service, I'd love to hear from you.  

3) Follow my blog and updates on indiegogo.  Your comments and support help keep me going during the harder times.  Post a comment on indiegogo. 

  

Where did the Parfait Party concept come from and what's the story with the cutlery set? 

After much debate with myself I bought a cutlery set as an act of defiance -  I will not just let this disease take over and that I can still do whatever I love.  The Parfait party is really about finding joy and inspiration everywhere and following your bliss and not accepting any limits. Find my stories here http://theparfaitparty.com
story_txt:
THANK  YOU ALL SO VERY  MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT AND CONTRIBUTIONS.
Thank you is such a small word but I know that you all know how much I appreciate your love, friendship, encouragement and donations. 
I shall be contacting you all shortly - and will be sending you the first of your gifts from us.
I  would love you to follow our story - yours and mine  here . www.theparfaitparty.com
If you  have a friend or company who would like to donate or become sponsors please direct them to this page https://parfaitparty.wordpress.com/rewards/
ONCE AGAIN THANK YOU, EACH AND EVERY ONE OF YOU ARE BEAUTIFUL PEOPLE WITH THE KINDEST OF HEARTS :)
Warm hugs from Vanessa 
Vanessa@theparfaitparty.com
 
 
Stage iv Breast Cancer v Parfait!
 Stage IV Breast Cancer may mean a lot less time to live but I have big plans, and they begin here ...
A) Buy a cutlery and parfait set (get back Cancer, I got things to do, parties to host) B) Exchange my comfy home for a mobile home and start an indefinite road trip - fundraise via indiegogo - please donate today.C) Write a series of books to inspire everyone to live life to the max ( at least the first issue anyway ) D) Hold fun raising events for local charities as I travel - I want to give back to local communities they are the lifeblood of any nation E) Party! Party! Party! I may not ahve long  but it is going to be fun :)
   
What if you get too ill or... err, ahem … well, you know... before the first book is published? 
 1) I don't intend to “err, ahem … well, you know” just yet. Statistics say 2% of people with this advanced/secondary/stage iv breast cancer live for many years. I INTEND being in that 2%! The other 98% survive between 3 and 5 years and I've used nearly  one of those years already.
 2) I have a great team who have helped me put this amazing adventure together. A member of my team will continue the trip and make sure every reward is delivered and the first book is published :) We've also got volunteer drivers in case I get too borked to drive long distances. Even if I need to pull up for treatments, the show will go on – Parfait Party Events will still be held and I'll skype in to anything I can't attend in person.
 Every single sponsor gets ALL this!
Absolutely EVERYONE who contributes will become a member of my virtual road trip and in addition to the rewards at your chosen level,  you'll also get:
1) an e-copy of the first inspirational book - "That's Awesome!"
2) an e-copy of the Parfait Party recipe book
3) you'll also get a twitter and blog shout out
4) listed on my website as a road trip team member
5) warm hugs and smiles
6) exclusive login to the bloopers/outtakes and other information
7) a souvenir screensaver at the end of the trip
8) the opportunity to purchase the book 'That's Awesome!' volume 1 at cost
9) your sponsorship acknowledged in any publication or video  produced
 BONUS: For this last 24 hours there is a special bonus for EVERYONE.  Each donor  will get a special electronic arts bundle put together by my very talented and generous arts team.  There is music, e-books, self development tools... it's an amazing showbag of e-goodies.  This goodie bag includes:
 1) ebooks for the children in your life by children's author  Micki Zee
The Drawing Club -  Book #1 Harrietts Golden Pen
The Kings of Nu - Book #! Seeing Red At Norah Head
http://www.mickizee.com/
 2) A Parfait Party mp3 unplugged from singer/songwriter David Llewellyn aka Bright Oh
Parfait Party collection vol 1 - The Sunflower  
Parfait Party collection vol 2 - Into My Arms
Parfait Party collection vol 3 - The Flame and the Arrow
http://brightoh.com
 3) Online membership and ebook for Richard Geer's Star Journey method
Do you often make choices because they clearly seemed like the right thing to do at the time, though there seem to be no words to express why?
Star Journey helps you understand the principle of synchronicity and shows how to tap innate intuition.  Make decisions, sdolve problems, explore relationships.
http://star-journey.com/
  
What will the indiegogo funds be used for? 
We need to get mobile! The Parfait Party needs funds to purchase a reliable motorhome/caravan for the road trip and pay some travelling costs.   I'm putting all my resources into this one last adventure, but I don't have quite enough to cover the whole lot.   
 
Interview with Vanessa
You're doing what exactly? 
The Parfait Party is an epic road trip, dotted with fun-filled Parfait Parties, with the aims of celebrating and publishing awesome true stories and fund-raising for local communities on the way. 
I want to live the rest of my life to the fullest and leave something to inspire others to do the same. I'm going to be roadtripping for as long as possible, hunting out people and stories that just make you go "Wow, That's Awesome!"  My blog and book will capture the spirit of fearless living. 
On the way, I'll host fund-raising Parfait Party Events around the country to honour inspirational people and stories and the funds raised will go to a local charity or organisation chosen by the  awesome person. 
 
The Road Trip sounds fun, can I come too? 
For some of the perks (over $3000) I'll pull over and open the passenger door.  Join me for a week on the road. (6 opportunities only).  
What can we do to help? 
1) Pass my story along on Facebook, Twitter, email, in person, carrier pigeon - whatever communication you have at your disposal - keep passing the story forward. 
2) Choose a perk or donate.  Money is awesome, but if you think you have a useful product or service, I'd love to hear from you.  
3) Follow my blog and updates on indiegogo.  Your comments and support help keep me going during the harder times.  Post a comment on indiegogo. 
  
Where did the Parfait Party concept come from and what's the story with the cutlery set? 
After much debate with myself I bought a cutlery set as an act of defiance -  I will not just let this disease take over and that I can still do whatever I love.  The Parfait party is really about finding joy and inspiration everywhere and following your bliss and not accepting any limits. Find my stories here http://theparfaitparty.com

story:
Hello Potential Funders:

For the past several months I've been pouring my heart, soul, time and kid's college fund into creating three e-books, which is essentially a digital culmination of my life's work as teacher and tech trainer. After years of helping  students, non-profit organizations, and others with social media and technology, I've decided to up the ante and create three  e-books on various technology topics. I couldn't be more excited about the work I've created and I'm eager to share it with everyone. 

Here's a summary of the e-books:

  • Passing the Final Cut Pro X Certification Exam.  It's a multimedia enhanced eBook chock-full of informative content, including 10 videos covering tips on how to pass this exam. I have proctored many tests and had great success with students passing the test.  I share my techniques and tips for becoming Apple Certified.
  • Choosing Yourself. I wrote a highly popular blog post about being about to choose yourself. This is an important first step in accomplishing any task. In this e-book I share how I almost got fired and then laid off, and how I choosing myself made all the difference. I also share ways to start a blog and start building your own digital platform.  
  • Pinterest for Guys. Why would guys want to use a site that is 80% full of women? That's right why?  It's because it can help you and your business grow.  And you can meet some pretty cool people in the process.
  • Above all, my hope is that my e-books  will be an invaluable learning tool for anyone who wants to learn how to pass certification test, change careers or find out how to use Pinterest for business.

 Who else are my e-books for? 

  • Students - make the most of your learning experiences in class and take and pass the Apple Certification Exams.
  • Aspiring entrepreneurs & career changers - To realize that choosing yourself is the important first step, but you must have a long term plan.
  • Men- to help you understand Pinterest and how benefit from it.
  • You!
 

Now that I'm almost ready to unleash my work to the masses, I'm realizing that creating the book is just one of many steps. In order for people to actually know that my books exist, I need to invest in things no writer likes to think about — distribution, marketing, outreach, and other initiatives to get the word out in a way other than asking my kids to tell their friend's parents about "daddys enhanced eBook series" at recess. That's why I decided to launch this Kickstarter with a funding goal of $4,500 — to help cover my production costs, but more importantly, to give my e-books an even better chance for success. That's where you come in.

Your support will help ensure that my e-book will be released in a timely manner and at an affordable price for everyone. The estimated release date is for the first book is January 2013. And if all goes to plan. I'll be self-publishing my books with help from Vook. It will be available in for Apple, Amazon, and Barnes & Noble platforms. BUT if you back the project at the $25.00 level or above, you'll get a DRM-free copy. (A copy you can view on multiple devices with no limits.)

Your support will also go towards paying some of the talented students and colleagues I've hired (at a considerable discount) to help produce and creatively promote my e-books in a way that will give it the best possible chance for being read.

story:
Hi, I am Christopher Jack Williams, Lead Editor for Ellipsis.

I want to thank you for stopping by this page and looking over our little gem of an Idea. What we are is a club dedicated to fostering a community of readers and writers in our area and one of the ways we want to acheive this is by having an open to the community literary journal, and that journal is Ellipsis.

This will happen, but with your help we can make it the best:

We are asking for $2,500 dollars so that we can publish the first two issues of Ellipsis in the summer of 2013 and 2014, this number is what we have decided will make it happen.

  • Once we reach our goal the money is divided in half and goes towards the publishing of each volume, all of it for each volume is for publishing, none of it will be used to comission art or anything, this is 100% for the publishing costs.
  • Our perks are as follows:
    • $1: Our thanks and gratitude
    • $10: Free issue of Volume 1 the moment we have it.
    • $10: Free issue of Volume 2 the moment we have it.
    • $25: Free issues of both Volumes.
    • $50: Editor autographed copy of both Volumes.
    • $50: Your name goes on the Special Thanks page at the end of the book.
    • $100: Bronze Sponsor Level, name goes on the Bronze Sponsor page and you get a free copy of both volumes.
    • $150: Silver Sponsor Level, name (or name of a Business) goes on the Silver Sponsor page and you get a free copy of both volumes.
    • $200: Gold Sponsor Level, name or scanned image of a business card goes on the Gold Sponsor page and you get two free copies of both volumes.
    • $1,250: Limited to 2 Dedication Level, the very first page of Volume One if you are the first buyer or Volume Two if you are the second is yours. Dedicate the book to yourself, your cat, your business, or have your own poem published on the first page.
  • If we do not reach our goal all money raised will go to getting Volume One published, if this happens any level that includes Volume Two will recieve an extra copy of Volume One instead.

The difference your money will make:


This journal will happen, this is something we are passionate about, our goal is to have this become a local living thing that happens long after we have left the school or the area.

But with your help we can make sure it has the best start possible. This is something that is designed to enrich the lives of writers and readers around us. We want local authors to be able to call Ellipsis home, where they feel safe, where they first got published, the first Journal to not send them a rejection.

This is the heart and soul of this project, the people of the community, and they have voices that need to be heard.

We are just going to be the microphone.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot help we understand, we wouldnt be asking for money if we had it ourselves already, we are broke college students who sometimes live off of ramen. But if you can not help financially you can still help get the word out, send other people here and see if they can help, share the link on Facebook, talk about us in local coffee shops to build street cred, everything helps. Just the fact you came to this page and read all the way to this point makes me love you just a little bit more than other people. Thank you for stopping by, and hopefully Ellipsis becomes the best Literary Journal it can be.

story:
Endless Awesome Mind-gasms and Realizations About Everything.

I'm writing a book about the enlightening realizations you get to when you examine everything for what it actually is. 

There's a whole lot more going on here than we realize. And I can't wait to share it with you.

If you step back and look at yourself, the world, and the universe through objective and rational thought, you'll be shocked at what you find.

This book analyzes what we already know through science, and discovers why we do what we do and why we're motivated to get better. We're all subconsciously doing a lot of similar things together, all the time, that we aren’t even aware of.

It also disects the truths about our reality, our conciousness, and our thoughts. And it offers incredible insights into what our future looks like, not too far from today.

It's all fascinating and it's all real. 

It's Going to be a Breeze to Read.

You can potentially walk away from this book with life-changing ideas that can empower you to become who you want to be, and to make of this life what you wish.

Or, it could just be a fascinating mind opener into the truths of our reality.

At the very least, you'll get a light, super-easy to read book, with topics that are incredibly fun to think about.

Either way, you're going to love it.

Here's Where You Come In.

I want to share these empowering and captivating ideas with you, but I need your help. I have about 80% of this book completed, but I need to really buck down to compile it and make it effortless to read. That takes time, focus and dedication.

So by pre-ordering today, you can help create a book that's as awesome as you are. :)

Your contribution will allow me to focus more of my time and energy into the completion of what I know will be an amazing book.

Once it's completed, you'll have a great book you helped make possible, delivered to your door, no matter where you live in the world. :)

If you'd like, you'll also be listed in the book as a contributer who made it possible!

Science is Amazing. It's Just Been Presented in an Uninspired Way.

I don't think you need to understand formulas to understand what science has discovered and what it implies. You just need someone to explain it to you in a more light-hearted, passionate and energetic way.

We don't know everything, but we know a lot. I want more people to understand what we already do know. 

This Book Doesn't Exist Yet. But It Will.

And that alone is inspiring.

Dreams are only dreams if you don't believe them. Dreams become real when you live them.

So let's make this one real.

Share This Campaign!!

If you don't care for this kind of stuff, please post it on your Facebook anyways so that one of your 800 friends will be able to be part of an awesome book they'll love to read. 

One More Thing. Bob Marley Was Right. One Love.

We're all the same.

We care deeply about sharing, spreading knowledge, improving conditions and contributing to the greater good.

The existence of this very website is a testament to that.

To the power we share collectively. To what we can achieve when we're all moving together towards what we love. 

We have a collective want to make great things possible.

But we can only do that with real action.

So I'm writing what I think will be an awesome book that could help the world, and you're contributing to it because you're a beautiful, wonderful, star of a human.

Thanks.

 

Want to preview my writing style? Hit the link to catch a glimpse.

http://www.sergiosbrain.com/how-everyone-is-afraid-to-do-what-they-love.html

story:
Help an Old Lady Buy A Shoe

Hi, I'm Maggie Rivers.  I'm an author.  I've been writing "The Stiletto" books with a friend of mine (C. Deanne Rowe) for over a year now and the books are doing great, thanks to all our fans.  They're three separate stories in one book and they each involve "stilettos" in some way.  At our book signings, we give away "stiletto" keychains as a token of our appreciation to those who buy our books. 

One day, a friend sent me the picture of what I call "The Stilettomobile".  Well, I just had to have it to take to our book signings.  Can you imagine the excitement that would cause!  It'll bring people out to our signings and in today's book world, you need something to draw attention to your books; something to make you stand out from the crowd.  That something for us is "The Stilettomobile". 

So, on Facebook, I asked who could build it for me and a lady I grew up with told me her son could.  He builds custom trucks and for him building "The Stilettomobile" would be a piece of cake.  Thus, my fund for the "Help an Old Lady Buy a Shoe" campaign started.  I made a sign to take to our book signings, put a picture of "The Stilettomobile" on it and started talking it up.  People love it and have been donating a few dollars as they could.

What We Need & What You Get

We need approximately $30,000.  That all goes to the young man in Northport, Alabama who is ready to build it.  He needs to buy the bike that'll go underneath the shoe and also have the shoe itself cast from fiberglass.

Once it's done, "The Stiletto Girls" as we've become known, will take it on the road.  Yep, we plan to take it to all our book signings, and drive it in parades and other events.  We'll bring it to a town near you and you can have your picture made with it.  It'll be totally awesome!

We're planning a contest for those who donate.  For a certain number of lucky winners, we'll bring "The Stilettomobile" directly to your town, right to your front door and we'll take you for a spin in "The Stilettomobile."  We haven't figured out just how many trips we can do in a year.  We both have to make a living so we work full-time jobs in addition to our writing.

If we don't make our entire goal, the money still goes to the young man and he'll work on "The Stilettomobile" as he can and as we continue to raise funds and send it to him. If we make more than our goal, we'll use the rest for the upkeep of "The Stilettomobile" like gasoline, oil, etc.

The Impact

Now "The Stilettomobile" may not be the top campaign in the world right now but at least it'll bring a smile to a lot of faces when it shows up at your front door.  You know you want a chance to ride in it and wave at all your friends as you pass by.  What a hoot!

Other Ways You Can Help

While most of you will be able to donate something to help us out, some of you may not.  But, you can still help.  You can spread the word about "The Stilettomobile" and help us get those donations rolling in.

The more noise we can create about our campaign the better our chances are.  So have fun with it, talk it up, tell your neighbors they're never going to believe what you saw!  Spread the word!

Use the share tools here at Indiegogo and get "The Stilettomobile" campaign going viral and "Help An Old Lady Buy A Shoe!"

So, on Facebook, I asked who could build it for me and a lady I grew up with told me her son could.  He builds custom trucks and for him building "The Stilettomobile" would be a piece of cake.  Thus, my fund for the "Help an Old Lady Buy a Shoe" campaign started.  I made a sign to take to our book signings, put a picture of "The Stilettomobile" on it and started talking it up.  People love it and have been donating a few dollars as they could.

We need approximately $30,000.  That all goes to the young man in Northport, Alabama who is ready to build it.  He needs to buy the bike that'll go underneath the shoe and also have the shoe itself cast from fiberglass.
Once it's done, "The Stiletto Girls" as we've become known, will take it on the road.  Yep, we plan to take it to all our book signings, and drive it in parades and other events.  We'll bring it to a town near you and you can have your picture made with it.  It'll be totally awesome!
We're planning a contest for those who donate.  For a certain number of lucky winners, we'll bring "The Stilettomobile" directly to your town, right to your front door and we'll take you for a spin in "The Stilettomobile."  We haven't figured out just how many trips we can do in a year.  We both have to make a living so we work full-time jobs in addition to our writing.

If we don't make our entire goal, the money still goes to the young man and he'll work on "The Stilettomobile" as he can and as we continue to raise funds and send it to him. If we make more than our goal, we'll use the rest for the upkeep of "The Stilettomobile" like gasoline, oil, etc.
The Impact

Now "The Stilettomobile" may not be the top campaign in the world right now but at least it'll bring a smile to a lot of faces when it shows up at your front door.  You know you want a chance to ride in it and wave at all your friends as you pass by.  What a hoot!

Other Ways You Can Help

While most of you will be able to donate something to help us out, some of you may not.  But, you can still help.  You can spread the word about "The Stilettomobile" and help us get those donations rolling in.
The more noise we can create about our campaign the better our chances are.  So have fun with it, talk it up, tell your neighbors they're never going to believe what you saw!  Spread the word!
Use the share tools here at Indiegogo and get "The Stilettomobile" campaign going viral and "Help An Old Lady Buy A Shoe!"

story:
Help Me Help the Women of the DRC

Family, Co-workers, and Friends,

Anyone who knows me knows how much I love what I do every day. I am passionate about the work that I’ve done with survivors of domestic and sexual violence for the past 6 years. Through this passion I found a calling to the field of social work and a hunger for social activism. What began as a class assignment for me this last semester quickly turned into a sense of responsibility to help the Women of the Democratic Republic of Congo.

Congo is the most dangerous place on the planet to be a woman or a girl.

 ** Since 1996, sexual violence in the eastern Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) has been used as a war tactic to torture and humiliate women and girls and destroy families. Hundreds of thousands of women and girls have been raped since the conflict began. In addition to the severe psychological impact, sexual violence leaves many survivors with genital lesions, traumatic fistulae, severed and broken limbs, unwanted pregnancies, and sexually transmitted diseases, including HIV. Survivors are regularly ostracized and abandoned by their families and communities. The women and children of the DRC pay the price for the consumer demand of these Conflict Minerals. **Please see the Conflict Minerals Video 101**

Now awakened to the atrocities that face the women of the DRC, I am committed to speaking out against this until the violence stops. I have been in touch with the Raise Hope for Congo Campaign, which works to create awareness on Conflict Minerals and has crafted a campaign specifically targeted to college students: The Conflict Free Campus Initiative. I plan to begin these efforts at Austin Community College in Austin, TX and I am asking that you help me in these efforts. On June 8th-10th, The Enough Project and Raise Hope for Congo Campaign will be hosting Act against Atrocities Advocacy Day in Washington, D.C. Here, I would have the opportunity to meet with Advocates from around the world for training, networking, and lobbying. I would have the opportunity to meet face-to-face with staff representatives or Members of Congress themselves when possible to inform them about atrocities unfolding in the world’s worst conflicts. I would also receive training, specifically from the Raise Hope for Congo Campaign Advocates to begin the Conflict Free Campus Initiative at Austin Community College. I would also volunteer to support a powerful exhibit and event called 'One Million Bones', a visual installation on the National Mall to commemorate past genocides and generate awareness and action on current conflicts in Sudan, the Democratic Republic of Congo, and other areas affected by mass atrocities.

What I am asking for:

  • My goal is to raise at least $800, I am asking for any monetary donation you may be able to offer at this time.
  • $550 is specifically to cover travel and lodging expenses from June 8th to June 11th. I would cover my own meals, cab, and bus fare, etc.
  • Anything above $550 will go directly to Congo Campaign and The City of Joy in Bukavu, South Kivu, a revolutionary center, created by V-Day (Eve Enseler and Vagina Monologues) for healed women survivors, providing them with leadership development, educational and income-generating opportunities.
  • These are the women that inspired me to take action and if I don't reach my goal for the DC trip, all the money I raise will go The City of Joy to help them, so PLEASE consider giving even a small donation.
  • Your donation could have a direct impact in the life of a girl in the Democratic Republic of Congo and help her heal from violence perpetuated by consumer demand of these conflict minerals.

The reason I am asking for help is because I am one person (a determined and passionate one for sure, but still one person.) This trip can connect me to others in this fight.

  • The opportunity to train, network, and lobby with other activists on Capitol Hill can have a significant impact on getting the Conlfict Free Campus Initiative off the ground in Austin, TX. If ACC is able to declare itself the second Conlfict Free Campus in Texas (only TCU has done so) then the University of Texas and/or Texas State, St. Ed's, etc can follow, this makes a huge impact on consumer demand for conflict free electronics in the city of Austin.
  • This is the new Blood Diamond movement and we can impact the lives of people if we act and demand conflict free electronics.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • If you cannot sponsor me in this effort at this time, I simply ask that you take the time to visit www.raisehopeforcongo.org and learn more about this issue. There are a number of things you can do from this website to help spread the word.
  1. Watch and share the Conflict Minerals 101 video via social media to your friends and family.
  2. Send your Representative a letter asking that he/she sponsor House Resolution 131.
  3. Send a letter to the 18 biggest electronic companies in the US demanding conflict free products.
  4. Send a letter to President Obama and Secretary of State John Kerry requesting they appoint a U.S. Special Envoy to lead a coordinated U.S. response to this crisis.
  5. Learn more about the Campus Conflict Free Campus Initiative and change your mind about joining me in this effort...
  • Share my campaign and spread the word on Raise Hope for Congo

Thank You for giving me a bit of your time. Peace and Love to you all

-Nancy Morelos

Send your Representative a letter asking that he/she sponsor House Resolution 131.
Send a letter to the 18 biggest electronic companies in the US demanding conflict free products.
Send a letter to President Obama and Secretary of State John Kerry requesting they appoint a U.S. Special Envoy to lead a coordinated U.S. response to this crisis.

story:
I have been a professional artist for 25 years. I wrote and illustrated "Millicent and the Faraway Moon" a couple of years ago to help myself get over my "not good enough" feelings and encourage others toward the same. I have sold 700+ copies mostly at art fairs and festivals and at some schools and book signings.I work tirelessly to get my book out there and I am constantly seeking new opportunities and independent stores to carry my book. I have just gotten my 10th retailer and my hope is to eventually get retailers all over the country in small stores and large carrying "Millicent".

"Millicent and the Faraway Moon" is a beautiful 40 page, full color, hardcover book for kids ages 3-9.The message of my story is one that resonates with children and adults alike.  It took a lot of money to print the book and I am finding that it takes even more money to market it to find a wider audience, something which my meager artistic earnings cannot continue to fund.

The goal of my campaign is to expand the reach of "Millicent and the Faraway Moon" by getting it into more schools, bookstores and libraries and making it available as an ereader book.

By expanding the reach of my book I also hope to attract the attention of a publisher.

Also, as I stated in my video, because of it's inspiring message, I would like to donate 75 books between Children's Hospitals in my area and School Libraries. 

 

****Please go to the Gallery page to read excerpts from "Millicent and the Faraway Moon"

Here's what  happy readers have to say about Millicent: 

  • "Millicent and the Faraway Moon"-“I love this unique children's book! It's beautiful message and wonderful illustrations are a treasure for the very young and old. Because of this I gave copies to all my grandchildren, nieces, and nephews.” ~Marilyn Desroches
  • "Millicent and the Faraway Moon"-“This is a lovely book about self esteem and how other's negative comments can influence how we see ourselves. Millicent's friend, the 4th Blind Mouse, helps her to see past the negative comments and overcome her self doubt. It's a great story and the illustration is fantastic! 5 Stars!!” ~ Suzi McNicholas
  • "Millicent and the Faraway Moon"-“A very creative and enjoyable book with a positive message for children. My wife and I are looking forward to giving it as gifts to our friends children (and keeping one for ourselves!).”~ By Eric Meyer
  • "Millicent and the Faraway Moon"-“I plan to read this to my grand daughters. This is a sweet life lesson for our young ones. Millicent, the cow, realizes her full potential and that she is "fearfully and wonderfully" made. Love the illustrations! I give it 6 stars!”~ By Nina Watts
  • "Millicent and the Faraway Moon"-is definitely a book every parent should have for their child and for themselves. It is a wonderful way to teach children of all ages how to over come self doubts. ~ Margaret Cummings, Delaware School Teacher 

 

Here are the specifics of what the funding will pay for: 

PROMOTIONAL ITEMS:

printing media kits ( multi-page informational packets sent to media outlets)

flyers

posters

printing postcards

stickers,T-shirts or onesies,buttons

packing and postage

ADVERTISING:

print advertising in local and regional media

web advertising (blogs,Facebook, Googleads)

SCHOOL VISIT AND BOOK TOUR EXPENSES:

informational packets, posters etc.

postage and packaging

booking

travel

lodging

BOOK GIVEAWAYS

EREADERS: 

formatting for each type of ebook reader

 

****I WILL BE ETERNALLY GRATEFUL FOR YOUR SUPPORT AT ANY LEVEL****

**** Please look on the right side of my campaign to see all the great perks I have waiting for you!

 Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make a contribution, that's ok. Please help by sharing my campaign with your friends,neighbors and coworkers. Post to your facebook page, tweet and just make some all around noise about it. Indiegogo has some great share tools for you to use too!
