story:
Short Summary

About 2000 years ago Aristotle said: "Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence."

I agree totally with him but have to add that "In addition, we are all Programmed by the Creator for that very purpose, namely Happiness."  

Then you may counter with: "If that is true, why is there so much unhappiness in the world?"

This book called Daily Happy Living, which is the culmination of my lifetime search for answers to happiness, answers that very question in great detail.  I also introduce my Joycentrix System - a set of five fundamental beliefs that are needed if we wish to live a happy life here and now (no matter what the circumstances).

My name is Gopi Menon and I am a 69 year old retiree whose profession used to be electrical engineering, but whose passion was and still is in finding ways to achieve true happiness, amidst all the confusion and frustration with the traditional methods taught for achieving happiness.

I am living with my wife of nearly 40 years and we are the proud parents of 3 married sons (who still keep in touch regularly from various parts of the world).  All our in-laws are wonderful people, plus I am blessed with 4 marvelous grandchildren.  So in the eyes of the world I am already successful and should be thinking of total retirement and being a full time babysitter to my grandchildren.

However, I feel that there is a larger purpose to my life and there is a deep personal yearning within me – to leave behind a legacy in the form of a great book which is truly useful for vast numbers of people who are mired in misery.

Therefore, because I believe so much in the message in this book, I want it to be published to the highest quality possible.

 

What We Need and What You Get

In order to achieve the highest quality in content I have already engaged a professional 'writing coach' from February 2012 at a cost of $315 per month which works out to about $3800 over the year.  Since I am a retiree living on a modest pension, I have had to charge this extra expense to my credit card.

My manuscript will be completed by early December 2012, after which I intend to get it Edited professionally and then Self-Published with a reputable publisher, namely Strategic Book Publishing and Rights Agency (SBPRA) or Trafford Publishing.  After that I intend to promote it using the AME (Author Marketing Expert) platform.

The total cost of these professional services work out to about $8800 and this is the amount I am looking to get funded.

I truly believe that I have been led to Indiegogo and to you the reader by Universal Synchronicity so that I can fulfill my lifetime goal.  (This universal synchronicity is a principle of happiness I describe in my book: 'What we focus on materializes through Precession which gets the Universe working on our behalf.')

 

The Perks:

Whatever amount you can contribute is accepted gratefully, and you get the appropriate Perks as shown on the right side of this page.  However, as an example, some of the practical Happiness Tools I give away are:

For a $2 Contribution: Download a PDF copy of 'My Own Universal Prayer of Gratitude' and 'My Own Favorite Affirmations, Insights & Quotations'

For a $5 Contribution: All the $2 Perks PLUS download my life changing report on 'How I Overcame Road-Rage almost Overnight'.

For a $10 Contribution: All the $5 Perks PLUS a download of my special 2- Part report which gives a fascinating new insight into 'Why does God allow Bad Things to Happen?'

For a $20 Contribution: All the $10 Perks PLUS download my PDF report on 'How a Marriage headed for the Rocks was Saved - by using just a few of the Happy Living tips mentioned in the Book'.

For a $35 Contribution: All the perks for $20, PLUS you get to choose a PDF version of either one of these 2 Kindle Books:

  1. 'Happy Parenting Principles' OR
  2. 'Baby Boomers Health Secrets'

For a $60 Contribution:  One signed Paperback copy of my book 'Daily Happy Living' when it is published (free shipping). PLUS all the perks for $35.

For a $100 Contribution: One  signed Hardcover copy of my book Daily Happy Living (free shipping). PLUS all the perks for $60.

For a $200 Contribution: Special for Authors and would-be Authors: Access to three Selected Audio Recording provided by courtesy of IACCW (International Association of Conscious and Creative Writers). PLUS All the perks for $100.

For those Authors and would-be Authors, please check out the IACCW website at: http://www.iaccw.com

My assurance:  I would like assure you that even if I don't reach the full target of $8800, I am still committed to publishing this book and delivering the promised perks to contributors.  

I am able to give this assurance because my services as a freelance Technical Writer is still required, even now.  However, I would really like to reach my funding goal, so that I can focus completely on writing, publishing and promoting this book, instead of taking up another Technical Writing assignment.

NOTE: 

  • All the Perks that are downloadable will be available approximately 2 weeks after the end of the campaign., i.e. by early January 2013
  • The signed paperback and hardcover books will be sent out as soon as possible after the book is published, in the first quarter of 2013.
 

The Impact

As you can see from the Perks offered; these are unique gifts that will help contributors achieve some little happiness in their life.

Also as a contributor, you would be spreading a Great and Timely Message to the world at large, thereby increasing the Overall Happiness Index in the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute, that's okay.  I do understand (I have been there many times myself) but you can still help by spreading the word among your friends in the offline and online world by using:

  • Twitter, Email, Facebook and so on.
  • You can also use the Indiegogo share tools on this page.

I thank you from the bottom of my heart for reading this far and for any action you may decide to take.

You can also check out my blog (although I have been unable to post in recent months because of my focus on this book) at http://DailyHappyLiving.com

Thank you.

You can also check out my blog (although I have been unable to post in recent months because of my focus on this book) at http://DailyHappyLiving.com
Thank you.

story:
Outsider Publications: to be launched soon, with your help!

Outsider Publications will be a small publishing house created by Christine Fasse and her team. Work is in progress on two new, exciting projects. Both involve photography, architecture and a new way of looking at how people inhabit spaces.

 

1. Architecture, God and Men: The Marabout in Algeria

Our first project will be a five-volume series on Algerian architecture; from early, traditionnal buildings, to the post-colonial architectural boom, heavily influenced by Le Corbusier and Fernand Pouillon. Each book will feature rare old photographs and postcards of the relevant period, with a short bilingual text (French/English) by Dominique Fasse.

The working title for the first volume is Architecture, God and Men: The Marabout in Algeria.  Marabout are North African hermit, but the word also refers to shrines built beside their place of burial. From coast to desert, their haunting presence is a constant element of the Algerian landscape. Orientalists of all stripes have made it a cliché. In this book the author presents a new perspective, and a selection of images, painstakingly researched and collected over many years.

Dominique Fasse was born in Paris in 1948. He lived in postcolonial Algeria from 1969 to 1987, working in agriculture and travelling throughout the country. Passionate about the rich literature and history of his country’s former colony, he has amassed a diverse collection of documents and images, including ten thousand postcards from the colonial period, 1830-1962. He is the co-author of Deserted Memory in collaboration with his daughter, a book of poetry and old photographs portraying ‘a colonial Algeria that refuses historical segmentation.’

 

2. A witness to history: The Royal Army Medical College

Christine Fasse and Felix Friedman will collaborate to produce a photography book recording in contemporary terms the site today occupied by Chelsea College of Arts and Design in London. For almost the entire twentieth century this building was home to the Royal Army Medical College. The book will be a ‘portrait’ of the building, but also of those who served there; including some members of the Friends of Millbank. The group regularly gathers at Millbank; this project will seek, similarly, to unite people, heritage and history.

The team will produce a beautifully crafted book with full-colour photographs, in high quality print. Therefore it will not only constitute a record of history of the RAMC but also a beautiful object in its own right, which will do its subject justice.

Christine Fasse studied cultural anthropology at the Sorbonne University. For the last nine years she had resided in the UK, first in Oxford and now in London. Christine co-authored several books. She is fascinated by the building at Millbank and has researched its history and photographic archives. For the last three years she has been involved with the Friends of Millbank. She is fascinated by collisions of the past and present, epitomized by this project.

Felix Friedmann is a photographer. He did a photography degree in Vienna and has been based in London for the last nine years. His work is grounded in a strongly traditional, craft based field. Most of his images are taken on 35mm film and 4x5 inch film sheets, a slow, exacting, hands-on process. Exhibitions of Felix’s work have taken place in Europe for the last ten years and his photographs have been published in a wide range of art magazines.

 

These two projects are already on the go, but we need your help!

Money raised will be spent on the whole book publishing process:

  • Launching the publishing house
  • Printing
  • Promotion
  • Distribution

Other Ways You Can Help

Post the project on your Facebook page! Spread the word!

story:
PROGRESS TO DATE:

1. I have located an artist and using the money already donated I have commissioned 9 illustrations to be used in the book.  I am also screening a finalist for the graphic novel artwork and I have open bids out for auditions to do the audio book on ACX.

2. I have hired a press agent and she is blasting press releases.

3. I have written a new chapter called The 8th Granny

4. I have written a new chapter called the Telling Trees

And thats just with $66 and a fiver account!

Please help me knock it out!

Carter

I am a man who was a boy who loved the old women in his life with heartfelt pride.  

My name is Carter Serrett and last year I wrote and self published an allegorical tale of seven unusual grandmothers trapped in Hell who are sharing their stories in order to find common links, mistakes and eventually a way to get the Hell out of Hell.

This is a story full of rich charchters that must be heard.  The release in December was well reviewed but did not go far in distribution.  

These Granny's deserve to be revised, re-edited and re-presented professionally.


This book was highlighted on iwant2behuman.com and was given a thumbs up by movie producer Michael Meltzer.


Please Help Dead Grannies Today.  You and you alone can help these multidimensional robust and complex grannies fix their wrongs, save the world and make it literally out of Hell.  

You will achieve this by helping them to spread their stories.


We need $5,400 in funding to pay for:
  1. Professional Support finding a literary agent $200
  2. Professional Copy Editing $1,000
  3. Profesional Content Advice from published Science Fiction/Fantasy Writer $1,500
  4. 8 Pieces of original art at $150 a piece $1,200
  5. Support writing query letter $250
  6. Support writing one page synopsis $250
  7. Legal Support $500
  8. Social Media Marketing $500
You can receive:
  • Signed copy of first edition, 
  • first printing of revised addition, 
  • printed acknowledgment, 
  • A Dead Granny T-Shirt, 
  • Tote-Bag and 
  • Pillow,
  • and the chance to name key characters.
The ears of troubled souls need this allegorical tale told in a twisted, funny, sardonic and unique way that allows the reader to open share in the shame each woman feels and the stregth to put it in perspective while focusing on the solution.  Its a magic realism blend of humans, fairies, demons and walking dancing singing trees. 

We have no experience in the publishing world and find ourselves spinning wheels.  These steps..while costly will provide my team with the focus, direction and brainpower needed to propel this project further.


If you can't contribute funds...PLEASE PLEASE share this on your page.

story:
My name is Brock Gill and I am an illusionist and evangelist.  My wife, Auny, and I have been traveling around the world performing and sharing the gospel of Jesus Christ for the last 17 years.  Along the way, we have seen some amazing, miraculous displays of God's power, protection, and provision.  It's time to share these stories. 

We are involving you, our friends, family, and fans, to make this a reality. We want this to be a team effort, and we want to provide a tool for you to reach your friends, neighbors, and coworkers with this book. This book will show the evidence of God's power and miracles that have shaped our lives and ministry.  We think it will be eye opening to believers and unbelievers alike.

Our immediate goal is  $10,000.  This sounds like a lot of money, but if we are going to self publish and get this book out there to people, it will take much work. We plan to put money into marketing, publicity, editing, art design, publishing, etc. etc. etc. This goal  we have set is the bare minimum to do what we plan to get this book launched. With your help, we will see it become a reality!!!

We want the perks to be fun incentives to help people give and support this effort.  Please spread the word about this indiegogo project by using twitter, facebook, and personal email.  Thank you so much for being a part of this project.  We could not do it without you!

story:
Short Summary

With the tragic news that greeted our homes though 24 hour cable news in the month of April 2014, #bringbackourgirls has been the first impression of Nigeria for many in the global community in recent times, as well as the usual dose of corruption, poor infrastructure, insecurity and bad governance. With this onslaught of negative output why would anyone want to visit? 

We are passionate about people and telling the stories of people and places that are not heard, that make Nigeria one of Africa’s true hidden gem.  As well as #bringbackourgirls, we have started a campaign to #bringbackourcountry by re-launching Come to Nigeria magazine, a response to those that are not a representative of what’s great about this nation and the global community will stand shoulder to shoulder with the Nigeria people by supporting us and telling the positive stories and sights of truly amazing Nigeria.

ABOUT US:

“Come To Nigeria” is an online and print magazine aimed towards promoting the good side of Nigeria that will unlock the tourism and investment potentials of the country. Nigeria is our primary market but we also target the reach of a global audience.

COMETONIGERIA Magazine is an excellent way to publicise and showcase Nigeria’s abundant wealth of tourist sites and attractions plus the country’s colourful cultural festivals.

The idea behind the magazine is to use it as a pictorial souvenir that captures snippets of Nigeria, the diversity, royal institutions, culture, natural endowments, business and investment opportunities as well as infrastructure and a compendium of tourist attractions in the country.



EACH ISSUE FEATURES:

  • Perfect bound —Each edition of the magazine is between 92 and 128 pages in size and the magazine have a perfect bound, high quality format to be distributed worldwide, through some embassies and high commissions as well as airports and travel agents, trade and tourism fairs.

  • Travel news features — Full length feature stories exploring current travel events and trends in the country's hospitality sector. From news and reports on ongoing infrastructure projects, to available investment opportunities, these features will keep you informed, engaged and inspired.
  • Travel guides — Visually arresting and inspiring travel journals from around the country. 
     
  • Editorial/cover story— Each issue features two interesting main stories extensively written for adventure-loving travellers. 

  • Fashion stories —A chapter of total eye candy celebrating Nigeria fashion, showcasing some of the finest designers, stylists and fashion show events. 

  • The Directory — A chapter dedicated to offer useful information such as important contacts of all foreign embassies and high commissions in Nigeria. It also features contacts of Nigerian embassies and high commissions abroad too. And don’t miss the directory of domestic and foreign airlines in Nigeria.

By supporting us now, you’re part of the solution as your support will help us continue to promote Nigeria in our own unique ways. We’ll need your continued excitement and support to keep the following issues coming.

What We Need & What You Get

The printing and production of the next 5 editions will cost us £75,000 (designing, writing, editing and other associated cost): £15000 x 5 = £75,000 because we plan to increase the number of our print run to 10,000 per edition.

Marketing and Promotion (online, electronic, print and mainstream media). Also on billboards and buses as well as undergrounds in the UK. In local, national and international newspapers and magazines), also at airports in the next one year: £90,000

Circulations and distributions around the world: £45,000

Computer Hard and software, contingency and office premises £20,000

We need a total of £230,000 that will enable continuity of production in the next 5 editions and promotion of the brand all over the world in print and electronic media as well as online. It will also enable us to circulate and distribute more copies around the world that will enable the readers to form a new opinion about the other side of Nigeria that they don’t see on television.

  • Where the funds go if we don’t reach our entire goal

If we are unable to reach the entire goal, the fund raised will still go on raising the profile of the publication enabling it to get stability.

We know there’s an audience out there who is hungry for this type of content. This is your moment to prove us right and help make this publication a success. 

SUPPORT US NOW!


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share the project page on your social channels and profiles. 

  • Write letters to the editor
  • Participate on our FB, Google+ and Twitter pages
  • Share our links
  • If you have a blog, write about us there
  • Tell people about the magazine

Talk about us. Shout it and please sing it to friends and family. Send us exiting stories and great pictures of your last holidays in Nigeria. 

Together we can do it: Come To Nigeria magazine is a dream come true for us and for our readers. Please help us not make the magazine a flash in the pan. The success of this campaign will enable us to properly kickstart the project and in turn help our production for a long time.

  • Please share this page with your progressive friends!!
  • And please use Indiegogo share tools !

story:
José Antonio

Es un chico nacido en 1976, que comparte su vida con su hija Bárbara de 8 años y con su pareja Raquel. Hace unos meses sufrió un desgraciado accidente de tráfico en el que perdió su pierna derecha.

La recuperación está siendo dura, pero José Antonio pone todo de su parte para intentar volver a tener la mayor normalidad posible, pero sin una prótesis adecuada todos sabemos que su empeño y esfuerzo será en balde.

A pesar de los seguros y del esfuerzo económico de José Antonio y su entorno, no cuenta aún con los recursos suficientes para comprar la prótesis que necesita. Por este motivo, un grupo de amigos hemos puesto en marcha este proyecto con el que queremos lograr que vuelva a una vida lo más normalizada posible que le permita disfrutar de su hija y su pareja.


La prótesis

Hoy en día las prótesis han mejorado considerablemente, aportando una gran versatilidad, lo que permite que los usuarios disfruten de una mayor independencia y comodidad. Sin embargo, también las prótesis se han encarecido de una forma generalizada.

La prótesis que necesita José Antonio cuesta un total de 12.000€, pero necesita 4.000€ para poder permitírsela.

En el caso de que no alcancemos la cifra, el dinero se guardará para la misma finalidad.


Cualquier ayuda es valiosa

Lanzamos este proyecto a todo el mundo para intentar llegar a todos los que pudieran colaborar. Hemos visto cómo otros proyectos similares han logrado ayudar a otras personas, y ponemos toda nuestra confianza en que también podremos lograrlo. 

Cada aportación, por pequeña que sea, cuenta y suma en nuestra lucha por conseguir el objetivo de José Antonio.


Confiaza

Somos conscientes de lo difícil que es generar confianza en un medio tan masivo como Internet, y hemos intentado ser lo más transparentes posible con la situación de José Antonio. En cualquier caso, estamos a tu disposición para cualquier comprobación o información adicional que necesites.


¿No puedes colaborar? ¡Comparte por favor!

Es muy probable que no puedas ayudar a José Antonio económicamente, si es tu caso, aún puedes colaborar. Se trata de difundir esta campaña, compártelo por todos los medios que tengas a tu alcance (Facebook, Twitter, WhatsApp...), es un gesto sencillo y que lleva muy poco tiempo, pero que tiene una gran repercusión.


Gracias

story:
Here's the problem:


Why does a child’s enthusiasm for their new history subject at the start of the new school term fade away after a week?

Because school history textbooks are boring. FACT. They are full of facts and figures, a sea of words and numbers peppered with the odd black and white illustration of an etching or if you’re lucky the odd historical photo. In fact less students are taking history as a school subject when they grow older: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-14666229

In school with fact memorising subjects like history, I often found myself detached; unable to recall key events and dates in my exams. Then my teachers tried something different the next term on our new subject the Tudors.

Instead of having us just scribble down key date after key date, we drew out the events of history like a comic strip. This creativity felt ridiculous at the time, but I will never forget how important a visual aid in this medium was. How did Henry VII increase his claim to the throne by becoming richer? A cartoon of the king taking taxes from nobles and taking land from rebels helped me picture this difficult fact.  This is where the inspiration for Simple History comes from.

Simple History aims to ease the young pupil into their favourite history subjects as an introductory piece. Key facts are easy to remember through full, vivid colour illustrations. Every key event in the timeline of a historical subject is portrayed as a cartoon making learning fun and inspirational. 


What We Need & What You Get

Six books have been authored and illustrated by myself already, over the course of this year. Your contribution goes towards marketing the books and spreading the word. Early interest has been good and a few sets have been dispatched to classes. On top of this, ‘Simple History: A simple guide to World War I - CENTENARY EDITION’ has reached the top 5 free (on free kindle week) ranking on amazon. However at the moment due to the infancy of the project, Simple History is a hidden gem.

*Your donation will go towards marketing, building trailers, printing sample copies to give to schools and your indiegogo rewards! :)

1) Marketing is required to get these books off the ground.  I will use your donation to promote the books through trailers, a press release and to build up the website (www.simplehistory.co.uk) and social media platforms. 

2) As you can see here: http://www.amazon.com/Daniel-Turner/e/B00H5TYLAE/ref=ntt_athr_dp_pel_1 I have self-published the books under the createspace platform. Your contribution would go towards printing copies in bulk. This would mean that costs would go down and we can get copies into classrooms. 


The rewards no matter how much you contribute are great, for you know that you starting a revolution to get children interested in history again. 

For those that donate expect: ebooks of Simple history and signed print copies coming your way and your name credited in the next simple history!


The potential of this series is huge. Here are some of the themes and characters from history I want to explore:


    Other Ways You Can Help

    Spread the word about Simple History!
story_txt:
Here's the problem:



 
Why does a child’s enthusiasm for their new history subject
at the start of the new school term fade away after a week? 
Because school history textbooks are boring. FACT. They are
full of facts and figures, a sea of words and numbers peppered with the odd black
and white illustration of an etching or if you’re lucky the odd historical photo. In fact less students are taking history as a school subject when they grow older: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-14666229
In school with fact memorising subjects like history, I
often found myself detached; unable to recall key events and dates in my exams.
Then my teachers tried something different the next term on our new subject the
Tudors. 
Instead of having us just scribble down key date after key
date, we drew out the events of history like a comic strip. This creativity
felt ridiculous at the time, but I will never forget how important a visual aid
in this medium was. How did Henry VII increase his claim to the throne by
becoming richer? A cartoon of the king taking taxes from nobles and taking land
from rebels helped me picture this difficult fact.  This is where the inspiration for Simple
History comes from.
Simple History aims to ease the young pupil into their
favourite history subjects as an introductory piece. Key facts are easy to
remember through full, vivid colour illustrations. Every key event in the
timeline of a historical subject is portrayed as a cartoon making learning fun
and inspirational. 


   What We Need & What You Get
 
Six books have been authored and illustrated by myself already, over the course of
this year. Your contribution goes towards marketing the books and spreading the
word. Early interest has been good and a few sets have been dispatched to classes.
On top of this, ‘Simple History: A simple guide to World War I - CENTENARY
EDITION’ has reached the top 5 free (on free kindle week) ranking on amazon. However
at the moment due to the infancy of the project, Simple History is a hidden
gem.
*Your donation will go towards marketing, building trailers, printing
sample copies to give to schools and your indiegogo rewards! :)
1) Marketing is required to get these books off the ground.  I will use your donation to promote the books through trailers, a press release and to build up the website (www.simplehistory.co.uk) and social media platforms. 
2) As you can see here: http://www.amazon.com/Daniel-Turner/e/B00H5TYLAE/ref=ntt_athr_dp_pel_1
I have self-published the books under the createspace platform. Your
contribution would go towards printing copies in bulk. This would mean that
costs would go down and we can get copies into classrooms. 


The rewards no matter how much you contribute are great, for you know that you starting a revolution to get children interested in history again. 
For those that donate expect: ebooks of Simple history and signed print copies coming your way and your name credited in the next simple history!

story:
Tripwire, a journal of poetics, is pleased to announce a new funding initiative for translation. Translation plays one of the most critical and vital roles in international literatures, but too often translators go unrecognized and unsupported. It is frankly impossible to imagine avant-garde poetries in the English-speaking world developing beyond their parochialisms without the vigorous and expansive work of translators.

The Tripwire Microgrants for Translation are designed to provide support and recognition for translators of contemporary avant-garde and experimental writing. Donations will be awarded to translators for new translations published in forthcoming issues of Tripwire. Please donate what you can—even the smallest amount will add up. 

image: Ana Teresa Fernandez, performance image from Borrando La Frontera / Erasing the Border, 2012. Tripwire 9: Transnational/Translational.

story:
Thanks to the generous support of so many people, the book will be released in December 2014. Thanks to those who made this happen.

Who am I and what's the campaign about?

My name is Edward Dougherty, a poet and community college teacher living in upstate New York. I have the great fortune to have my third collection of poems accepted by Plain View Press, a small  publisher with a big vision. Here's a line from Plain View's About Us page:  "Despite evidence that relentless violence has taken root worldwide, there is hope and there are artists to show the human face of it."

Why support Plain View Press?

Plain View, which published my book, Part Darkness, Part Breath, nearly had to close when its founder, Susan Bright, passed away. Her vision and passion held it together for nearly 30 years. She was editor, book designer, publisher, promoter, and chief bottle washer. When she was gone, things looked bleak.

Pam Knight has done nearly miraculous work to re-organize the press. But we can help. Not only will this campaign bring my book into the world, it will assist Pam to keep a small press viable. If you give more than the goal I set, I'll just order more books and keep the community growing!

About Everyday Objects

This s my most personal collection to date. It’s a kind of spiritual autobiography, made up of many strands, all of which I think readers can relate to.

While many of the poems are from my experience, I don't think the book is really about me. It's about the kinds of transitions that help each of us become an authentic person, which is what I'm still trying to do.

One thread recalls formative moments, like having my mom read Stuart Little to me and my younger sister (check out YouTube) or getting the nerve to tell my dad I wanted to quit playing pee-wee football. Others honor moving out of the family home, my dad’s cancer, finding the love of my life, and her breast cancer treatment, and our enduring love to this day.

There's also  a number of “everyday shames,” those small experiences that teach us our limits, and a series of “The Art of Attention” poems about crafting artwork, which may be a similar discipline to how we shape our lives, families, and friendships.

Finally, the title strand of poems deal with everyday objects, like the bath tub, clothes pins, the electric cord, and the single shoe that once had been the display models. By playfully imagining the “inner life” of these objects, these poems also reflect common human struggles. 

All this is shadowed by the social context of war—WWII for my parents and in-laws, Vietnam, 9/11 and the subsequent War on Terror for the rest of us.  How can we avoid being “mere tools, objects / in another’s hand” so that even amid dehumanizing forces we can be true? I ask this of and for myself, but I hope it resonates for readers, too.

Visit my site to read samples--I've posted a pdf of a selection. 

Please help: I've never sent a Twit!

I believe in community, so please get involved. You can help making connections.
  • Encourage people to pre-order a copy by Sept 14, using this campaign. Email your family or friends or people at work about my book--I really think they'd like it, even if poetry isn't their thing. 
  • Send people to my site or YouTube channel.
  • If my work speaks to you, comment on it or pass them along to others.
  • I also really need help with social media! To get things to trend, take a simple step:  Follow or Share the campaign. Post a link on Facebook or other elsewhere.
  • Invite me to read in your local library or school. April 2015 will be another National Poetry Month, and it's not too early to plan.
  • Read the book. And if you like it, please post your thoughts on Amazon,  Goodreads, or other readers' forum.
  • Arrange for me to facilitate your creative writing group or class. I use activities like ones in Double Bloom: Exercises for Poets, a book I co-wrote with Scott Minar, to get writers to fill the air (and their notebooks!) with poems.

story:
Can you lend a hand?

There is a beautiful teenage girl in Washington state who was in an auto accident in 2012 that left her scarred, both physically and emotionally.

She is still recovering a year later, and is making great strides. Her goal was to enter a pageant, which she did recently. She won at the state level as part of the International Girl Pageant, and is now eligible for the national pageant in Dallas in late July.

But she can't afford the airfare, clothing, etc. She has been holding yard sales and car washes trying to get funding, but is still quite a bit short.

I am an author of children's books, and would like to help her by donating the profits of my latest book to Felisa. My book, "The Shadows at Sundown" tells the story of children as they watch a favorite uncle's long slide into dementia. It is a educational and entertaining story; it's a good read, and your purchase will go to a great cause.

Felisa is a wonderful speaker. We are in the same brain injury support group, and she inspires me every time with her positive outlook. Nothing will stand in her way of success -- except a lack of funding.

Can you help this beautiful teen achieve her life goal?

Here is a link to the story that ran in the local newspaper: http://www.yakimaherald.com/valleylife/unleashed/1192095-8/car-accident-survivor-looks-to-future

What We Need & What You Get

My book is still being edited, but should be out in July. It will sell for $14.99 at amazon.com but I am offering pre-sales for $9.99. And again, the proceeds will go to Felicia in her effort to go to nationals.

I am pushing this to help out a wonderful girl, one I know only casually from our brain injury support group.

If you donate $15 (price includes shipping cost), I will send a copy of "The Shadows at Sundown."

If you donate $25, I will send you an autographed copy of my book.

And if you donate $50 or more, I will send you an autographed copy of my book, as well as any other of my books at http://www.amazon.com/Michael-Rock/e/B006C9CJ16

Pass the word around, and let's get Felisa to nationals.

story:
Hello!

My name is Liam and I am a student and blogger from here in Melbourne. Those of you who know me know that I take a close interest in issues of politics and human rights. One issue in particular though has always held my attention: the Palestinian struggle for independence and human rights.

In June last year I visited the West Bank for the first time as part of the Holy Land Trust’s Palestine Summer Encounter program, a program that aims to educate university students about the ongoing conflict in the Holy Land. I stayed in Beit Sahour with a Christian Palestinian family who were generous enough to take me in and share their home with me.  My host father William is a blacksmith and is known around his local church as Abu Shaarib because of his brilliant moustache and my host mother Rula is studying to be a counsellor and teach theology at a local bible college. Their love and dedication inspires me every day. Their two sons Matthew and Michelle are two loveable troublemakers who I’ve fallen in love with as well.

The Occupation and my mission!

Although I was familiar with the politics of the region before my visit I was completely unprepared for the harsh reality of the occupation that confronted me. I was confronted with civilians being shoved around by soldiers in the street, tear gas being fired at children and houses being demolished in front of the family who were only a few minutes beforehand forced out of them.

As a human rights activist I had an obligation before I visited Palestine to do what I could to inform others here in Australia about what is going on. However, after having visited the land and made life-long friends in the area I now feel that I have both a moral commitment as well to do all I can to alert Australians to the struggle for Palestinian rights.

Driven by this obligation I am returning once again to Beit Sahour to learn more and volunteer with the Palestine News Network, a news outlet that has recently been established and is currently developing an English language department to help broadcast news from Palestine to audiences in America and other countries including Australia. I will be working there for two months helping to research and write articles as well as translate articles for English publication.

Having been fortunate enough to be offered such a role at the PNN I am currently seeking sponsorship to cover my trip and the associated flight and touring costs.

So this is where you guys come in!

I'm asking for like-minded people to help me on my mission. So if you're interested in human rights and quality journalism then why not pitch in a few dollars to help me out?

I would be delighted to, upon my return, deliver a report and presentation of what I have learned and achieved during the trip; and how these lessons will inform my work and mission here in Australia.

I have included a link to my blog below where I write about Palestine and the popular resistance movement.

www.fromtherivertothesea.com

story:
About the Book:

Nine Lilies is an anthology of short stories and poems that are varied in their content but similar in their theme. The anthology contains 9 character-piece stories that revolve around the psychological effects of dramatic change. This reflects my written work, both in poetry and prose, over the past 4 years as I have been navigating my education as an English Major and passionate writer studying and living in New York City.

Following through the anthology you will meet Amar, a 27 year old architecture student who has returned to Croatia after the Balkan War and 20 years living in the United States, only to discover his family and birth place are not as he left them. 

You will also meet Som Touben, a reflective piece based on the real story of a man who was treated as a comatose patient for over 20 years until doctors found out that he was actually conscience during his entire time during treatment. This is a story from his perspective of what it is like to see everything from the inside out, when no one knows your listening.

Finally, you will meet me, a 20 year old patient in Mount Sinai Hospital under the influence of heavy medication after a car accident as I walk you through the ins and outs of being treated for 3rd degree burns, and how to art of poetry, the love of family and friends, and a strong faith in something like god helped me beat surgery.

This, including short poems about a grandfather with Alzheimer's, a trip to the natural history museum, and more, collectively describes the psychological devices we all use in order to get through hard times and make sense of the tragedy that befalls us from seemingly no where. It is about love, loss, and pain. It is also about how I found myself through poetry and writing, and how sometimes, using these tools to connect with people in our lives is the only way to heal. 

 

About the Author: 

Emily Jelica is a 21 year old writer living and breathing in New York City. Originally raised in New Jersey by her mother, a Serbian immigrant, and her father, hailing from Massachusetts, she spent her childhood years with a loving and supportive family that included her older brother Zachary.

Emily's writing began at the age of 9. Inspired by a traumatic family event, she began writing poetry fervently and has not stopped. Since that age, Emily has been published in an anthology entitled "Sunflowers" by Eber and Wein, and has competed in the nationally-ranked Barnard Poetry Slam team as one of it's five members. Collaborating with such artists as the NYU slam team, Brian Omni Dillon, and Carvens Lissant, Emily flourished as a poet while on her slam team and continues to grow from the lessons they taught her.

Currently, Emily is a student at Barnard College studying English Language and Literature with a passion for spoken word, poetry, and fiction writing. In her spare time, she likes to create short movies, go for runs along the Hudson River, and eat barbecue foods. Her plans for after college include graduate school for Social Work and getting this book published.

Emily's literary idols are Saul Williams, and her 11th grade English teacher Mrs. Burgoyne, who continue to inspire her to keep putting pen to page, no matter how hard you must push to be a true "word warrior".

story:
I am Bridgett, a senior in college at Transylvania University in Lexington, KY. I am creating an online zine about art, music, writing, etc. All genres, for everyone. To create this zine though, I need a little help with expenses, paying for shows, creating merch, paying for website fees. Any and all donations would really help. 

This zine will encompass so many genres so it can reach to so many people. I have interviewed people from across the spectrum. As a kid, I hated music magazines because they were so focused on only one genre but at PLP whether you like Metal or Rap or Clog-Dancing, you will find something to read about. 
The website is under construction, but you can checkout the rough draft of our logo at 
www.parkinglotpatchwork.com

Please help and you will get perks for donating!

story:
Hi, everyone! My name is Lyra Shanti, and I am a novelist, poet, playwright, and songwriter. My sci-fi/fantasy series, Shiva XIV, is currently in its third installment, (The Riddle of the Gods,) and the fourth chapter, The River of Time, is due out in late 2017, with one additional book to follow. There are also Shiva XIV short stories that are being released this year.

You can read about Shiva XIV on Amazon:
https://www.amazon.com/gp/kindle/series/B01MXKKIBJ

At the Supercon in Fort Lauderdale, one of the biggest conventions in the world, there are countless new readers and scifi/fantasy fans who would LOVE to start a new, unique series like Shiva XIV! Help me to connect with them and build my audience!

To get to the Con, I will need to purchase an "Artist Alley" table, which is listed on the Supercon site as $175 plus tax. I will also need at least 20 copies of all 3 books in the Shiva series, which will cost roughly $200. Final costs will include a couple of fancy banners, business cards, and random cool swag that will decorate the table, all to attract Con guests to learn more about the world of Shiva XIV!

Now, the perks! If you help me achieve my goal to get to the con, you'll get a special mention in the "Acknowledgements" section of the 4th book in the Shiva XIV series, as well as a special sneak peak of the book before anyone else! And if you pitch in $25 or more, you'll get a kindle copy of all 3 books for FREE or a signed paperback of book one!

Any amount helps, but so does sharing! If you can't give to the cause via money, you can help with sharing about this goal through Facebook, Twitter, or anywhere you think book lovers and awesome people are to be found!

Thank you so much! I wouldn't even be brave enough to be an indie author without your help, so thank you to my readers and to all my friends and family! <3
story_txt:
Hi, everyone! My name is Lyra Shanti, and I am a novelist, poet, playwright, and songwriter. My sci-fi/fantasy series, Shiva XIV, is currently in its third installment, (The Riddle of the Gods,) and the fourth chapter, The River of Time, is due out in late 2017, with one additional book to follow. There are also Shiva XIV short stories that are being released this year.
You can read about Shiva XIV on Amazon:https://www.amazon.com/gp/kindle/series/B01MXKKIBJ
At the Supercon in Fort Lauderdale, one of the biggest conventions in the world, there are countless new readers and scifi/fantasy fans who would LOVE to start a new, unique series like Shiva XIV! Help me to connect with them and build my audience!
To get to the Con, I will need to purchase an "Artist Alley" table, which is listed on the Supercon site as $175 plus tax. I will also need at least 20 copies of all 3 books in the Shiva series, which will cost roughly $200. Final costs will include a couple of fancy banners, business cards, and random cool swag that will decorate the table, all to attract Con guests to learn more about the world of Shiva XIV!
Now, the perks! If you help me achieve my goal to get to the con, you'll get a special mention in the "Acknowledgements" section of the 4th book in the Shiva XIV series, as well as a special sneak peak of the book before anyone else! And if you pitch in $25 or more, you'll get a kindle copy of all 3 books for FREE or a signed paperback of book one!
Any amount helps, but so does sharing! If you can't give to the cause via money, you can help with sharing about this goal through Facebook, Twitter, or anywhere you think book lovers and awesome people are to be found!
Thank you so much! I wouldn't even be brave enough to be an indie author without your help, so thank you to my readers and to all my friends and family! <3

story:
About the Poet

Shery Alexander Heinis is an emerging poet in the poetry community in Ottawa, Canada. She was born and raised on the island of St. Lucia in the Caribbean, and currently lives and works in Ottawa.  She studied International Relations at the University of the West Indies (Jamaica) and Cambridge University (UK) and is a former diplomat with the High Commission for the Countries of the Organization of Eastern Caribbean States in Ottawa.  She is widely travelled and has worked in a number of areas including diplomacy, foreign affairs, global development, trade, tourism and investment, and small business in both the public and private sectors.  

As a young girl, reading and writing were her greatest passions.  She took up writing again a few years ago to help her navigate some challenging times in her life. Writing has since become a refuge, an avenue to express her creativity and imagination, and to articulate her life experiences and observations. She wrote her first chapbook A Greater Whole in 2014, following which she decided to take the plunge and work at writing her first volume of poetry.  As life would have it, she had to put this on hold for over a year for medical reasons.  She began writing again in 2016 and plans to release her first volume of poetry in November with your help!  Her poetry is imbued with eclectic imagery, colour, soul, power and warmth. 

What We Need & What You Get

Publishing a book takes a lot of time, dedication and...you guessed it...money.

By contributing to this project, you are helping cover the printing and distribution costs of high-quality books as well as helping pay for professional editing.

Our reward tiers will include:

                       $1-9  Thank you on social media

                       $10    Digital edition of the book

                       $25    Physical copy

                       $30    Physical copy + digital copy

                       $50    Signed physical edition + digital copy

                       $100  Signed Edition + framed poem + digital copy

                       $300  Private Poetry reading @ the home of the backer (within Ottawa) + $100 tier                                           rewards

The Impact

Your contribution helps make a lifelong dream a reality!  You can help bring the words of this Caribbean-Canadian lady into the homes and lives of people around the world.

Risks & Challenges

I've already engaged a publisher and an editor, but your contributions help pay the costs for their services.  As with anything, unforeseen circumstances may lead to publishing/release delays but we are currently on track for a release in November.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not in a position to contribute right now, that's OK!  There are still ways for you to help:

  • Please share the link to this campaign on social media;
  • Spread the love through word of mouth
  • Come to my next event:

                  November 12, 2017

                  2-4 p.m.

                  Bar Robo, 692 Somerset St. W., Ottawa

story:
¿Qué?

Velas rojas es una reflexión hacia el pasado sobre el papel de las civilizaciones, el valor humano de unas inocentes, los tejemanejes del poder y, básicamente, una historia de amor entre un minoico y una reina helena.

Entre los siglos XIV y XIII a. C. tienen lugar una serie de acontecimientos históricos cuyo protagonista es un capitán minoico, Perieo, decidido a poner su embarcación al servicio de quienes lo paguen. En esta ocasión debe traer un metal el sideron (hierro) desde la desconocida Hesperia para abastecer al imperio hitita a través de los griegos, llamados entonces aqueos, micénicos o helenos. Pero en la travesía ha de llevar a dos mujeres nobles/reinas que van a ser desterradas de sus patrias para llevarlas al más lejano lugar del occidente, Medea y Altea.

En definitiva se trata de una Odyssea con diversas aventuras, pueblos inesperados, tribus y demás curiosidades a lo largo de la travesía, donde se recogen los nombres más antiguos de islas o países que conocemos hoy día, tales como Mélite (Malta), Sequelia (Sicilia), Shardania y donde aparecen las rivalidades de reyes, imperios, y noticias de esa época tan legendaria como desconocida, así como la suplantación de las divinidades femeninas por las masculinas.

Todo ello envuelto por personajes mitológicos (o reales), cuya historia no es la que conocemos por las obras del clasicismo, sino defensa verosímil que nos da otra perspectiva sobre las acusaciones a que fueron condenadas. Todo ello dando un giro inesperado del mundo en que vivían, donde la antigua religiosidad femenina fue bruscamente aplastada por la masculina.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionales pero de indudable calidad, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para promocionar cada título cuando esta todavía se encuentra en proceso de edición.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Mario Sánchez i Candela.

Nacido en 1962, es licenciado en Filología Griega, Filología Hispánica y ha ejercido como Profesor Asociado Docente e Investigador de Griego Clásico de la Universidad de Alicante, donde también cursó su Doctorado. Ha sido coautor de Los campamentos Saharauis a principios del siglo XX, y ha publicado La otra, Ganímedes, El collar de malaquita, Acaso fue un sueño, La pulsera de Lapislázuli, La verdad lo que no tiene es remedio, La verdad de Alice y Esa buena gente.

Se define como la última de sus novelas, Esa buena gente,  humanista de los de definición Homo sum et nihil humani alinum est (soy un ser humano y nada de los humano me es indiferente), y aficionado a escribir, en sus ratos libres, relatos y novelas cortas y largas, regulares, mediocres y malas como no podía ser de otra manera.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Cuando abandonó Mélite supo que, después de recalar en la inquietante isla de Pythecussa,  si soplaba una buena brisa llegarían a las costas de Shardania, pero no era su intención hacer escala en ella. Sabía de numerosos piratas en aquella parte, así que se dirigiría a las islas de Melussa, Cromiussa, Pythiussa y Ofiussa en muy poco tiempo, por tanto puso rumbo a ellas notando que el viento era el adecuado e hizo que recogieran los remos y desplegaran las dos velas rápidamente.
          Aquel habría sido un buen lugar para abandonarlas si Perieo hubiese sido otro hombre con menor dignidad, pero si juró que las llevaría a Hesperia, allí las dejaría. No obstante, le inquietaba el momento de arribada a la isla a la que estaba entrando en medio de enormes acantilados por lo que había escuchado sobre ella y sus habitantes, aunque el temor no era menor en cuanto llegara a las islas cercanas a Hesperia que él sí conocía.
          No olvidó los sacrificios cruentos de algunos hombres y niños, bastantes años atrás. Sobre todo en Ofiussa, en donde una gran divinidad en forma de serpiente era adorada por extrañas y salvajes tribus que no dejaban acercarse a nadie a sus poblados.
         También temía los proyectiles que lanzaban con hondas de duras pieles y correas aquellos bárbaros y que atinaban en una distancia de más de tres naves a lo largo. Aquellas tribus eran temibles y desconocidas. Suspiró profundamente Perieo pensando que de todas formas, si llevaba a aquellas dos brujas en su barco, ¿de qué había que tener temor? ¿No habían salvado al despavorido Lemionos en Mélite?»

 

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 980€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción BACK IT es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Mario Sánchez i Candela vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad

story:
Vermont lacks a newspaper that will connect popular movements with the general public. Independent political candidates, union organizing campaigns, strikes, universal health care, and industrial energy projects all deserve better reporting. Vermont Movement News will be a platform for consistently telling our own stories, providing essential context, and combating corporate media bias. A print newspaper is critical for reaching regular Vermonters. We have a great team that's ready to put out Vermont Movement News, but we need your help to fund it!

GOALS:

$2,500 - This benchmark will cover the cost of printing every two months; six times a year throughout 2015!

$3,650 - This benchmark will also cover essential expenses like printing subscription cards, postage, professional art, a website, VMN t-shirts, and an annual dinner fundraiser.

$5,500 - This benchmark will allow us to transition into a monthly publication. Eleven issues for 2015, plus all the above!  This means more stories, more timely information, and a steady relationship with our readers.

$7,500 - All the above, plus a modest stipend for VMN collective workers!

$10,000 - All expenses paid!  This will allow us to give out copies at events for FREE!  Expand each issue from 8 pages to 12 with a color cover! This will put Vermont Movement News in the hands of *many* more people and shake the political establishment!


*** We reserve the right to reject ads.  This wouldn't happen without a conversation of course.  But we want to be accountable to people and organizations that share our mission, not the capitalist class.  Email us at peopleunite@verizon.net if you have any questions.


*** Special thanks to Heather Pipino of the Vermont Workers Center, pictured above burning her medical bill at a protest against Governor Peter Shumlin who broke his promise to fund Green Mountain Health Care after the election.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
I'm a writer. I've never earned much money from it and I've had other jobs along the way in my 44 years on this planet, but writing is what I've always done. It's in my blood, it's how I try to make sense of the world, and how I communicate. I write poetry, short and long fiction (two self published novels), and music journalism. I've been published by the Quietus, the Stool Pigeon, Shindig and other publications; I've had a short story published in an anthology alongside Irvine Welsh and Alex Garland; I've had praise for my writing from David Bowie and Henry Rollins. But as I said, I've never made much money from it. For the last two years or so I've been working on a book about the fertile psychedelic music community in East Texas in the 1960s, that produced bands like the 13th Floor Elevators, the Moving Sidewalks (later ZZ Top), Fever Tree, Bubble Puppy, the Golden Dawn and the Red Crayola. I've interviewed many of the surviving players, dug deep in my research and offered my critical opinion on the important LPs they produced. It's also a very human story, of innovation, talent, and struggle that too often ended in ignominy, tragedy and burn-out. Anyway, it's being published by the respected independent publisher Zero Books at the end of June. 
From the 8th-10th May in Austin, Texas, there's a music festival happening called Levitation. This annual event was formerly known as the Austin Psych Fest. It's a celebration of psychedelic music, with bands playing from all over the world, but it's also an acknowledgement of Texas's psychedelic heritage, and especially Austin's. This year, THE great Austin psychedelic band- and arguably the first and greatest psychedelic band ever- will be reforming to headline Levitation with a 50th anniversary show. Anyone reading my book will realise how incredible and unlikely this reunion of the original surviving 13th Floor Elevators is. So Levitation really is the ideal place to launch my book.
It's important to note here that Zero haven't given me any advance or promotional budget. I'm funding this completely on my own. The festival organisers have kindly given me a spot on site to promote my book and talk to festival goers about it, but I need to pay for the advance printing of a batch of books to be shipped to Austin ahead of publication date. I need to pay for my flight from the UK to Austin. I need to pay my hotel bill and any other costs incurred while out there, promoting my book at the festival and hopefully to the Austin media as well.
This is why I'm turning to crowdfunding. It feels pretty cheeky, and the perks I'm offering are fairly humble. But obviously anything you can give me will be appreciated. I am spending my own money on this, but if my friends can help ease some of the financial burden I'll feel like you're there with me. But hey, enough of my yakkin'; just please, slip inside this house as you pass by.
I
story_txt: I'm a writer. I've never earned much money from it and I've had other jobs along the way in my 44 years on this planet, but writing is what I've always done. It's in my blood, it's how I try to make sense of the world, and how I communicate. I write poetry, short and long fiction (two self published novels), and music journalism. I've been published by the Quietus, the Stool Pigeon, Shindig and other publications; I've had a short story published in an anthology alongside Irvine Welsh and Alex Garland; I've had praise for my writing from David Bowie and Henry Rollins. But as I said, I've never made much money from it. For the last two years or so I've been working on a book about the fertile psychedelic music community in East Texas in the 1960s, that produced bands like the 13th Floor Elevators, the Moving Sidewalks (later ZZ Top), Fever Tree, Bubble Puppy, the Golden Dawn and the Red Crayola. I've interviewed many of the surviving players, dug deep in my research and offered my critical opinion on the important LPs they produced. It's also a very human story, of innovation, talent, and struggle that too often ended in ignominy, tragedy and burn-out. Anyway, it's being published by the respected independent publisher Zero Books at the end of June. From the 8th-10th May in Austin, Texas, there's a music festival happening called Levitation. This annual event was formerly known as the Austin Psych Fest. It's a celebration of psychedelic music, with bands playing from all over the world, but it's also an acknowledgement of Texas's psychedelic heritage, and especially Austin's. This year, THE great Austin psychedelic band- and arguably the first and greatest psychedelic band ever- will be reforming to headline Levitation with a 50th anniversary show. Anyone reading my book will realise how incredible and unlikely this reunion of the original surviving 13th Floor Elevators is. So Levitation really is the ideal place to launch my book.It's important to note here that Zero haven't given me any advance or promotional budget. I'm funding this completely on my own. The festival organisers have kindly given me a spot on site to promote my book and talk to festival goers about it, but I need to pay for the advance printing of a batch of books to be shipped to Austin ahead of publication date. I need to pay for my flight from the UK to Austin. I need to pay my hotel bill and any other costs incurred while out there, promoting my book at the festival and hopefully to the Austin media as well.This is why I'm turning to crowdfunding. It feels pretty cheeky, and the perks I'm offering are fairly humble. But obviously anything you can give me will be appreciated. I am spending my own money on this, but if my friends can help ease some of the financial burden I'll feel like you're there with me. But hey, enough of my yakkin'; just please, slip inside this house as you pass by.I

story:
Money raised will support the nomination and election of Melanie Mark to British Columbia's Legislature, where she will be the first First Nations women ever elected to hold a seat in the Legislature in Victoria.

Melanie has worked as a Child and Youth Advocate from the Office of the Representative for Child and Youth since its inception in April 2007 until January 2013, when she assumed responsibility for the RCY’s advocacy mandate, Aboriginal relations, community outreach and youth engagement. She has nearly 20 years experience working directly with children and youth in a variety of roles. She is responsible for building and maintaining effective collaborative relationships with all levels of government, First Nations and Métis organizations, and community leaders. Ms. Mark is of Nisga’a, Gitxsan, Cree and Ojibway descent and holds a Bachelor of Arts degree from Simon Fraser University.

For more information visit: http://www.melaniemark.ca/

story:
I’m with Geek is a new geek culture and entertainment site and digital magazine aiming to showcase the very best from the geeky world! We source new, talented writers from around the globe to provide you, the reader with the very best and highest quality content. 

Senior Staff

     Editor - William John (editor@imwithgeek.com)

    Assistant Editor/Head of Design - Kim J Osborne

    Assistant Editor/Creative License - Matthew Battles

    Business & Development Manager - Alex Doust

 

The staff we take on are dedicated and talented individuals who strive to make the magazine as good as it can be.

Our editor, William John, is a graduate of Media Writing from the University of Greenwich. While he was there, Will started and ran the University's official publication, Latitude Lookout. This is where he discovered his love for journalism. After leaving Greenwich and realising how hard it is to break into the industry, Will decided to start this project and works incredibly hard to bring the magazine from strength to strength. He's awesome, truly.

Kim is our designer. Another graduate from Greenwich, Kim originally studied Digital Film Production but since then has moved onto freelance Graphic Design and Photography. Her speciality is magazine design and overall branding and she hopes to own her own studio and gallery one day.

Matthew Battles is currenty studying at Greenwich for his masters in Creative Writing. He's an aspiring author and divides his time between coursework, his novel and working part-time. Alongside Will, he was the assistant Editor of Latitude Lookout and now heads Latitude Radio, and does a bloody good job at it too! He also heads I'm With Geek's Creative License section.

Alex Doust is our business and development manager. He's helped the magazine expand so much since joining the team and we honestly couldn't have got this far without him. He's currently studying for a degree in Health Science and spends his spare time writing for us and helping to expand our reach.

See the rest of our team here:

Geeks are everywhere! The truth is that there isn’t a way to really define a geek, a geeky interest maybe but not an overall geek. Nowadays, if you just have an interest in something, you can be considered geeky and it’s not a bad thing. Being a Geek is something to be proud of, but you don’t have to be a geek to enjoy our content! If you have interests in any subjects such as Movies, Music, Television, Comics, Books, Technology, Creative writing, Digital image production, we’re bound to have something for you.

Being a magazine, I suppose the first goal is simple. We want keep providing Geeks and everyone who is interested with reviews, features and opinion pieces on the media that they love. Whether it’s film and TV or Comics and collectables, I’m With Geek wants to be at the centre of it. We want to be the primary source of entertainment for all the geeky individuals out there, because you are awesome and you deserve it.

Our second goal is a more personal one and was decided on by the company founders when the idea for I’m With Geek was originally conceived.

Almost every writer who has tried, knows how hard it is to get a job, you often come across this never ending loop 

At I’m with Geek we believe in taking chances on talented writers with little or no experience. We believe that so long as your passion for the subject is there you can provide high quality content. We also have a team of dedicated Editors who prune articles and help our writers gain the valuable knowledge and experience they need to exceed in their career. In short, we think differently, and we’re never afraid to take a chance on someone and as we grow, we hope to do more and more to destroy that horrible loop! 

 

Currently I’m With Geek runs a relatively small, ever-growing team who all work incredibly hard to provide you with the highest quality content whilst trying to develop into a successful business that can expand to help and entertain more and more people. We want to grow, it is our intention to launch the E-Magazine for London MCM Comic-con and hopefully within the first year, a published print magazine showcasing the very best our writers have to offer, with plenty of exclusive content. Following from this, we'd like to expand into other media outlets, but we'll save that for another time...

 

Quite honestly, the best way anyone can help us is to invest in our future. As the above video explains, we need an advertising budget in order to expand and reach the widest audience we possibly can. With your support we can produce advertising materials such as leaflets, printed t-shirts, wristbands etc. as well as cover costs of transportation and entry/table prices at sci-fi conventions around the country.

So what can we do for you? To the side is a list of the perks we’d like to offer in exchange for your funding. Some of them may appeal to certain people more than others, but hopefully you’ll find them equally, well, cool! All perks apply to the lower tiers too, so if you were to give £75 for instance, you’d claim the free advertising, the subscriptions, T-shirt, letter and so on. Pretty decent, huh?!

In addition to the perks, we’re going to continue doing our very best to entertain and engage you through our daily updated site and our monthly issues of I’m With Geek e-magazine!

We like to be totally open about what we do, if you have any questions that we haven’t answered above, please feel free to contact us via email –editor@imwithgeek.com or leave a comment below and we’ll do our very best to get back to you as soon as possible.

story:
This is a story of an unborn baby and his conversation with God and why he is to be born a crack baby who becomes a famous musician.

Born Into Pain is the first novel of the Teach The Dream series.

Hi my name is John Seda. Many years ago I was approached by a friend who lives in Los Angeles. She was working with a drug rehab center, so she asked me if I could write a song about a strong theme. A song about crack babies and the reason for the song was to portray the serious problem with many young mother's that were smoking crack. Their goal was to send out a message through music. At first I was kind of shocked, because the first thing that came to my mind was (wow) that writing this song was going to be hard, but I was determined and I'm not one to walk away from a challenge. After many weeks of thinking about it, the idea finally hit me and it became clear to me how I would write the song.

So I came up with the idea to write a song about a baby in heaven talking to God and asking him a question. Why he would be born this way? So I called the song Born Into Pain. This song was the inspiration for the creation of a movie script. Me and my colleague Orlando Martinez who I met a little over a year decided to take on the quest to make a movie script from the song and notes that I had envision what the movie would be about.

Orlando writing skill is one of the best I have seen, so between the both we completed the movie script. I am also working with Kimochi Neina from Guatemala who created the poster and book cover. So naturally the next step that we took was to turn the script into a novel and this way we can sell the book to raise money and eventually fund the movie.

The book process will take 6 months to edit from a movie script to a book with the assistance of Author Susanna Green and it will cost $5000 so we need backing in order to complete this project. We are here on IndieGoGo.com seeking backers to help us cover the cost to produce the novel. If go over our goal we will use the money for promotion of the book.

Best Regards,

John Seda

Here is a synopsis of the story:

Giovanni Del Santos has spent his very public life advocating the power of the arts by using his music as a prime example. His work has inspired pop culture beyond imagination. Yet, like every artist, Giovanni has dealt with the pressures from the music industry, the scrutiny of the media, the pressures of fame and the temptations that comes with it. Giovanni was: Born a musical prodigy. Born to be an icon. Born into the pain of addiction. Born Into Pain.

Here is the lyrics to the song performed by The Producers Heart and Soul featuring Dan Hougesen. The song that inspired the movie script and the book now on Itunes:

https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/born-into-pai...


Born Into Pain Written and Produced by John Seda
Recorded at Rising Sun Music in Tampa Florida
Mixed and Mastered by John Seda
Dan Hougesen's Vocals recorded at Pop Shit Studios in Copenhagen, Denmark.

The Producers Heart and Soul
Dan Hougesen - Lead Vocals
John Seda - Guitars, Keyboards, Percussion and background vocals.
Jose Santana - Drums
Colby Ward - Contra Bass
Joe LaSpina - Background Vocals
Charles Glenn - Bass

Illustrations: Kimochi Neina http://www.kimochineina.com/

Here I am
Waiting my turn
For life without a choice
To bear the burden that will be upon me
To be born into pain

As I waited my turn
I often wondered who I would be
I can't imagine
Playing the part to be
Born into pain

Descending from Heaven
I'll be born Into pain
No choice in the given
I am here to share my mother's pain
I feel my mother's pain

No Choice! No Choice! No Choice! Born into pain
No Choice! No Choice! No Choice! But to live

Temptation will be my eternal fate
Like a vampire's eternal damnation
I must overcome the pain
To become stronger from my mother mistakes

Oh Mother you gave me no choice
Mother here my voice
Oh God It's hard enough as it is
Why all the rock and dust.

Born into pain
That's my fate
Being born into pain
That's my pain

Didn't imagine things would turn out this way
As I waited my turn up here in heaven
Upon me comes a burden and not a choice
Looking through the eyes of trouble I await

There was something I must have liked about you
See I choose my fate.
Born to be given
And to overcome of being born into pain

Here I am
Waiting to be born
Here I am
Waiting to be born

Here I am
Waiting to be born
Here I am
Waiting to be born

Born into pain
Born into pain
Born into pain
Born into pain

 

Born Into Pain:

Please visit our page: http://www.bornintopain.com

Please like our page on Facebook http://www.facebook.com/bornintopain

BornAMusician.com:

Music distributed by: http://www.BornAMusician.com

Please like our page on Facebook http://www.facebook.com/bornamusician

Rising Sun Music:

Music recorded at Rising Sun Music: http://www.risingsunstudios.com

story:
From May 8-16 I'll be going on a 30K/per day cycle through the West Bank.
 
The Peace Cycle started out in 2003 as the brain child of two long term Palestinian rights campaigners. Both agreed that more needed to be done to raise awareness of the impact that the Israeli occupation of the Palestinian Territories is having on the people on the ground, amongst other issues. ‪ ‬
‪ ‬
‪The concept was relatively simple; provide volunteers from around the world with an opportunity to take part in a non violent, environmentally friendly awareness-raising event that would provide support and solidarity to those campaigning for peace in Israel-Palestine.‬
 
Cycling has succeeded in exciting and engaging press and politicians alike. On the first Peace Cycle in 2004, twenty-five cyclists from 10 different countries rode together from London to Jerusalem through France, Switzerland, Italy, Greece, Jordan, and Israel-Palestine. Sharing their message of peace and justice with activists and journalists alike en route, they arrived in the West Bank to an astounding welcome from the Palestinian people, and attended an official meeting with then President Yasser Arafat at his Ramallah Headquarters.
 
In 2013, the Peace Cycle will be meeting in Nazareth, and then cycling together between different key areas across Israel-Palestine (see map below).

 
 
Along the way we will have a chance to visit Jenin refugee camp, the Jenin Freedom Theatre, Al Najah University, as well as meet a range of human rights groups, representatives of the Christian Peacemaker teams, and local families and others that we are hopeful will be able to make time for us while we cycle through.

 
The organisers of the Peace Cycle rely solely on donations from supporters, from the supporters of the cyclists, and from the cyclists themselves, in order to finance the Peace Cycle trips each year.
 
It would therefore be wonderful if you felt able to give a donation - you have a couple of options!
 
If you would like to make a direct donation to the Peace Cycle, you can simply visit the Peace Cycle website, http://www.thepeacecycle.com/ , and select the yellow 'Make a Donation' button, which will take you straight to the Peace Cycle's secure PayPal page
 
Each year, the Peace Cycle nominates a chosen charity, in order to help raise awareness and funds for important but often overlooked charitable work taking place in Israel-Palestine.
 
The 2013 chosen charity is the International Middle East Media Center (IMEMC), a media centre developed in co-operation between Palestinian and international journalists to provide independent media coverage of news from Israel-Palestine. The IMEMC is able to combine Israeli and Palestinian journalists' deep understanding of the local context, history, and socio-political environment, with international journalists' skills in non-partisan reporting.
 
The IMEMC is a not-for-profit educational organization and, like the Peace Cycle, relies on donations in order to carry out its work.
 
For further information about the IMEMC, you can visit their website, and donate there: http://www.imemc.org/
 
And, last but not least, if you would like to make a donation directly toward my own personal costs of participating in the Peace Cycle (travel, food, accommodation, bike hire, medical care should my body fail me..:) ) then you may do so right here!

Thanks for your support everyone!
 
Love,
Percie
