story:
Why We're Back

IC Magazine still needs your help!  In our previous campaign a total of 48 people heard our call, helping us raise about forty percent of our budget. We're  deeply grateful for all the support we received, but we can't stop there. We still need to raise another $2865 in order to effectively continue our work in 2014.

What is IC Magazine?

For the past 10 years, IC Magazine has stood at the forefront of the global indigenous movement. As a grassroots publication run by volunteers, IC strives to bring you authentic and uncompromising news coverage concerning the world's Indigenous Peoples without the corrupting influence of corporate or government sponsors.

Over the years, IC has built up considerable momentum as a key source of news for Indigenous issues, carving out a unique journalistic niche that serves more than 30,000 people. Picking up where other media disappears, to date we've published more than 3000 stories, produced two documentary films and published three printed magazines, all on a shoestring budget.

As a forum from which to seek and offer international solidarity for the world’s Indigenous Peoples, Nations and allies, the mission of IC is crucial in its efforts to insure access to information that informs and empowers entire communities to take advantage of the global momentum happening at any given moment in their own quests for justice.

What We Need

At this point in our journey with you, our readers, friends and allies, we are humbly asking you to stand with us so that we can continue or work.

Right now, we need your help to cover our basic operating costs and a few upcoming fees  connected to our ongoing expansion of IC Magazine. In a nutshell, we are trying to establish a non-profit organization so that we can

  • Fund and carry out special investigations (in the spirit of the Pulitzer Center on Crisis Reporting)
  • Pay writers for their work and hire a small staff
  • Rent an office space in Winnipeg

In addition to this, we are planning to

  • Bring our premier annual magazine, People Land Truth, to universities and bookstores across North America.
  • Start a monthly podcast 
  • Take on interns
  • Produce even more documentary shorts
As well, we are going to start honouring the many great journalists  out there by handing out annual awards to those who truly peal back the layers, informing, educating, inspiring and challenging us.

Finally, we're going to take on more writers and editors to make sure every story gets the coverage it needs.

What You Get

As an added incentive for helping us carry our vital work forward,  we have a tonne of amazing stuff to give away, including  IC stickers, shirts and a selection of our magazines in print and ebook format.

Our friends from the Dub Collective IR (Indigenous Resistance) have also kindly given us a couple handfuls of their 25th album, Dubversive, a sampling of which you can find here.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have any money but sill want to lend a hand with our campaign, you can help us spread the word! Tell your friends and colleagues,  link to our campaign on Facebook and twitter,  or make a blog post somewhere! Anything you can do get the word out would be most appreciated.

If you want to help on a more long-term basis, you can also become a monthly sustainer.

If you're a writer, you can also put together a story for us. The exceptional work of our authors gets cited in reports, re-published in magazines, noted in documentary films, and studied in grade schools and universities across North America. Sometimes, our authors even get awards for their good work!

story:
The Story

The Reign of King Dagon saga began in 2009 when a video game monster came to life and discovered it could use the Internet to conquer the Earth. It was defeated when its designer and a mercenary IT Tech joined forces, but it was not killed. Published on Paul Juser's fiction blog, "Laugh at Yourself First," the epic story comes to a close 12/31/14 in a harrowing CHOOSE-YOUR-QUEST. You don't have to wait. In March, the entire story will be available in a series of 3 Kindle ebooks or one print edition. Your donations will be used for production and promotion.

For You

For only $5 you can have your name attached permanently to this exciting story. All donors will have their name listed in a special "thank-you" section. If you can spare $10, your signed copy of the book will arrive a week before the Amazon release date. Dissatisfied with these tiny donations? You can earn a truly special perk. The first $1000 donor gets Paul Juser's beard, an exact replica of the beard he wore in his first feature-length film, "Demon Messenger." 

About the Author

Paul Juser is the author of "The Salvation Shark," "Man-In-Sea," and monthly contributor to the legendary "National Police Gazette." His short stories and poems have been published internationally, and he regularly updates his fiction blog, "Laugh at Yourself First," which can be read at www.printisbetter.com

story:
Terroir Champagne: The Luxury of Sustainable, Organic and Biodynamic Cuvees is the first book exclusively dedicated to the Terroir wines of Champagne which are produced in an environmentally friendly way


Hi, my name is Caroline Henry. I am a wine writer specializing in Champagne. For the last 3 years I have been living in the region and I have become obsessed with Terroir Champagne. It is the only Champagne I buy & drink at home and I love sharing these rare wines with friends and family.

That is why I am writing this book: Terroir Champagne : the luxury of sustainable, organic and biodynamic cuvees

So what is Terroir Champagne?

Unlike regular Champagne which aims for standardization, terroir Champagne is all about individuality. These wines express the uniqueness of a place as perceived by the winemaker. The winemaker or the producer is key, as it is he or she who commits to an environmentally friendly way of farming. This is important because to make terroir wine the soil in the vineyard needs to be alive, and this unfortunately is a bit of an anomaly in Champagne, which still is one of the most polluted wine regions in France.

A second point is that the yields need to be reasonable as this will allow the grower to pick the fruit when it is ripe rather than the minimum appellation degree. Again this is not the norm in Champagne where appellation limits are generally considered as the absolute minimum.

Healthy ripe grapes will make a more balanced and rounder base wine, without too much intervention and additives from the winemaker. The winemaker just provides the framework for the terroir to express itself. However, his personal preferences of vinification, blending, aging and dosage will also add to the uniqueness of the cuvee.

Different, unique and individual – terroir champagne is also a real luxury- going back to the original definition of the word. These wines are rare, hand crafted and authentic and they are only about 0.02% of the total champagne production. They are a luxury because of their rarity and they are in demand. Fine wine importers, sommeliers and champagne geeks all over the world have started to realize the real value of these cuvees and have been actively pursuing them. 

Yet even if they are sought after they are often hard to find for a Champagne outsider. To date there is no reference guide dedicated just them so Champagne lovers need to weed through generic works in the hope to find out more about environmentally friendly producers. This is why I feel this book will add a lot of value.

What will the book cover?

I am to create a reference guide/travel guide covering environmentally actively engaged producers. 

In the first part of the book I will talk about the viticultural and wine making practices in Champagne before I delve into specific environmental practices as well as accreditation (Haute Valeur Environmental, Ecocert, Demeter, Biodivin).

In a second part I will talk about more generic terroir characteristics per sub region, before giving an overview of the winemakers who I believe make terroir wine in this sub region. I will tell the story of each producer and delve into the the why and when they decided to make terroir wines. I will also give an overview of the cuvees.

In a last section I will give hints and tips to make the most of your travel in the region and where you can discover our terroir products. I will include places to stay, places to eat (including regional specialties), as well as wine stores or wine bars where one can discover the Champagnes of the producers covered in this book.

Why Self Publish?

Real sustainability, organic and biodynamic growing are still a bit of a taboo subject in the Champagne region. Producers who chose to emphasize the life in their soil above their yields are often badly viewed by their neighbors as they are often presumed to be the cause of all disease.

On the other hand, now that the interest in Terroir Champagne is growing, a lot of people are starting to talk terroir, even if their way of working is not very environmental.  And most Houses who buy the majority of their grapes are reluctant to impose a real sustainability program out of fear to loose contracts to the competition.

Since I only want to include producers who really care about the environment and don't want to be pushed into including brands who don’t, I need YOUR support to self publish. It is the only way to remain neutral.

What will be covered by the money?

To realize this project I will work with a professional photographer, editor and designer and these people all need to be paid. The remainder of the money will go towards the first print run and fullfilling the perks.The initial €10,000 is the bare minimum needed to realize publish the book; it does not include any pay for me.That is why I hope to raise more. More money will also allow me to work with a professional map creator and to publish the book in hard cover.

In order to raise the funds needed to publish this book I have put together an exciting range of perks. All of them will allow you to get your own insider knowledge to the terroir wines of Champagne.

All donors will have their name included in the acknowledgements of the book.

Perks start from €15 for a T-shirt. Furthermore, any donation above €25 will include personalized copy of the book itself. Other perks include unique terroir tastings, tailor made Terroir Champagne trips, including a special tour guided by me. Depending on the time of the year, the trips may include a unique harvest or vins clairs tasting experience.

Risks and Challenges

The biggest risk for me is not raising enough money as this would mean that the book will not be published. The reason is that environmentally friendly terroir wine is only a very small segment of the the Champagne market, and most larger and best known players are not involved in this terroir movement...

My challenge is to raise the money and finish the book to be published by SEPTEMBER 2015, in time for next year's Holiday Season. I have most of the material but I need to revisit everybody to take portraits and to include the new cuvees. I also want to include new and upcoming producers who have started to work in an environmentally friendly way as well and need to make sure I do not forget anybody.

Why me??

Why do I feel I am the right person to write this book? I am a trained wine professional and certified sommelier who regularly lectures about Sparkling wine and more specifically Terroir Champagne.

As I have been living in the region for the last three years I have gained a thorough understanding of conventional grape farming in Champage versus the real sustainable, organic and biodynamic vineyard practices. Furthermore I know every producer included in the book personally, having visited them several times.

I am very passionate about these kind of Champagnes and have organized many tastings around these wines - most notably I participated with 18 Terroir Champagnes at the International Sparkling Wine Symposium tasting and 14 Terroir Champagnes at the Three Wine Men tasting both in London. I have also written many articles about them, mainly on my blog, but also for Wine-Searcher, Decanter, Palate Press, Winerist and Vinogusto. 

Other ways you can help

I understand that not everybody has a lot of spare cash to donate to this project but that you may still want to help. You can do so by sharing the video and the link to this project with your friends, family and network. The more people will talk about Terroir Champagne, the more interest in this specialized section of the CHampagne market will increase, and the more chance I will have to meet my goal and publish my book!!!! 

I hope you will join the real luxury movement in Champagne by supporting this one of a kind environmentally friendly project.  THANK YOU VERY MUCH!!!!!

story:
* The Story *

I had a childhood friend named Suzie. We spent a lot of time together along with her little pug dog  – a happy little fellow who always kept us entertained. I must admit that I've forgotten his name now. He was Suzie's best friend and companion. He played with her when she was lonely and picked her spirits up when she was down. I enjoyed creating adventurous stories about the little dog, some of which made her roll over with laughter. Suzie’s little dog grew to a ripe old age, always by her side well into her 20s, giving her great joy until the end. Although we moved across the country several times, Suzanne and I always kept in touch. After we each got married, the contact grew lesser and lesser, but she was never far from my thoughts. Several months ago, I learned that Suzanne had passed away from cancer. She was only 55 years old, still too young. I remembered the stories we used to create, and wanted to keep her memory alive, possibly through my own series of stories of a little rambunctious pug dog named Pugnacious.

Not so long ago, my son, now grown up, left home to start his own journey. It was then that I decided to write and publish my first book, "Sweet Pea in the Pumpkin Patch." That revived the writing bug. The memories of Suzie and her pug gave me the inspiration to develop the "Pugnacious" series. I know she would be happy.

The first book, “A Christmas Star for Pugnacious” finds Pug lost on Christmas Eve. He spends the day trying to find his way home in time for Christmas. As the day turns to evening, Pug starts to lose hope that he will see his beloved Andy again. Is there a miracle in the works? Will he make it home in time for Christmas?


* What I Need & What You Get *

As any writer will tell you, self-publishing is a big task. The funds will be used:

  • to complete the publishing process, including illustrations (which are still being created) and book cover design;
  • cover the cost of the first print run (enough for the launch and perks);
  • and for marketing so the book doesn't sit on the shelf.
There are a variety of perks available, including my favourite – an opportunity for you and your pet to be immortalized as characters in an up-coming book.
Please Note: All copyrights are held solely by the author. Names and characters depicted in a Pugnacious book as a result of this campaign do not give the bearer any rights to royalties of said book.

* Why I Need Your Help *

My goal is to launch the first in a series of children’s books in time for Christmas. If I can surpass my goal, I would also like to make a donation to the Breast Cancer Foundation in Suzanne's name.

* Risks & Challenges *

If the worse case scenario happens and the goal is not met, funds collected will be used to deliver the perks first, then the balance will go towards accomplishing our initial goals of publishing and marketing the book. But I have faith that by Christmastime, my beloved book will be sitting under the tree and in stockings.

* Other Ways You Can Help *

Some people don’t have the means to contribute, no matter how much they would like to. If that’s your case, you can still participate by sharing this project with your friends and family. Share with a pet owner, a parent, a teacher… "Like" our Facebook page. Your efforts would be very much appreciated. Thank you in advance.

Remember to look for the Indiegogo share tools.

first draft picture

* An Excerpt From The Book *

It had started to snow earlier in the day. Pugnacious was excited. Not only was it just two days until Christmas, but he was going to help Andy decorate the tree. Andy came into the living-room with a box of decorations – wooden ornaments, colourful glass balls, blinking lights and a wide ribbon garland. Pug danced around Andy's feet anxious to get started.

"Settle down boy," Andy chuckled, "the tree's not going anywhere."

Andy opened the box and started to place the ornaments one by one on the branches. Pugnacious grabbed a wooden nutcracker with his teeth and handed it to Andy.

"Thank you, this will go nicely right here," Andy said as he placed the little ornament on a branch. Pug then went to the box of glass balls. He tried rolling a ball to Andy with his nose, but instead got entangled in the lights. The more he squirmed, the more tangled he got. Pug was sometimes clumsy. Andy rolled over in heartfelt laughter. Finally, after releasing Pug from the lights, they finished decorating the tree. It was beautiful with the colourful ornaments, blinking lights and a silver star perched at the top of the tree. Pug was pleased with his part in the decorating, although small as it was. After admiring the tree for a while, Andy and Pug went out to play in the fresh snow.

As Andy was building a snowman with some friends, Pugnacious saw a squirrel in the bush at the edge of the yard. Without a thought, Pugnacious darted out towards the squirrel.

Andy called out, "Pug, stop. Come back here. Pug!"

But Pugnacious didn't hear. He was intent on catching the squirrel. Even though Andy chased after him, the little dog was just too fast. 


Thank you for taking the time to read my story.

advance.
Remember to look for the Indiegogo share tools.
first draft picture


* An Excerpt From The Book *
It had started to snow earlier in the
day. Pugnacious was excited. Not only was it just two days until Christmas, but
he was going to help Andy decorate the tree. Andy came into the living-room
with a box of decorations – wooden ornaments, colourful glass balls, blinking
lights and a wide ribbon garland. Pug danced around Andy's feet anxious to get
started.
"Settle down boy," Andy
chuckled, "the tree's not going anywhere."
Andy opened the box and started to
place the ornaments one by one on the branches. Pugnacious grabbed a wooden
nutcracker with his teeth and handed it to Andy.
"Thank you, this will go nicely
right here," Andy said as he placed the little ornament on a branch. Pug then
went to the box of glass balls. He tried rolling a ball to Andy with his nose,
but instead got entangled in the lights. The more he squirmed,
the more tangled he got. Pug was sometimes clumsy. Andy rolled over in heartfelt
laughter. Finally, after releasing Pug from the lights, they finished
decorating the tree. It was beautiful with the colourful ornaments, blinking
lights and a silver star perched at the top of the tree. Pug was pleased with
his part in the decorating, although small as it was. After admiring the tree
for a while, Andy and Pug went out to play in the fresh snow.
As Andy was building a snowman with
some friends, Pugnacious saw a squirrel in the bush at the edge of the yard. Without
a thought, Pugnacious darted out towards the squirrel. 
Andy called out, "Pug, stop.
Come back here. Pug!" 


But Pugnacious didn't hear. He was intent on
catching the squirrel. Even though Andy chased after him, the little dog was
just too fast. 

Thank you for taking the time to read my story.

story:
Why We Need Your Help!

September 18, 2014 marks an exciting turning point in the history of Scotland. 

The referendum campaign of the last two years has awakened a renewed vigour and passion in politics never before seen in this country.

Many assertions, promises and accusations have been made by both sides in a debate which has split the nation.

Traditional mainstream media has not served the people well. The views of almost half the population of Scotland have been routinely ignored or even ridiculed by an industry which is far from independent and unbiased.

There needs to be a new, alternative platform which is free from fear or favour. One which will hold the establishment and elected representatives to account. One which will showcase achievements, identify problems and debate the solutions to create a better, fairer and more inclusive society.

Whatever the outcome of the vote Scotland will never be the same again. The people who turned the debate from a political campaign into a grassroots movement for change are not going to fade away quietly and nor should they.

iScot brings a team of multi media professionals, investigative journalists, broadcasters and writers with all the support needed to create a sustainable and credible alternative source of news and information.

iScot will create a new multi-media platform, including a digital magazine which combines text, video and audio to fill the vacuum created by mainstream media.

We want to give a new generation of journalists, broadcasters and opinion formers the opportunity to keep the momentum for change and public engagement.


What We Need & What You Get

Your contribution will help seed fund an online platform hosting a daily web service and monthly digital magazine, incorporating video and audio. Our aim is to lay the foundation for a truly independent media for Scotland.
Our initial target of £ 40,000 will enable us to fund essential start-up equipment and talent to cover the stories that matter. We believe the people of Scotland are no longer willing to take unsubstantiated claims, from whatever source, at face value. A truly independent media exists to be the eyes and ears of the people and to vigorously question and examine the issues which impact us all.
We will provide fair and balanced news coverage of Scotland and its people to audiences around the world.
  • £ 40,000   =
  • Inaugural Monthly Digital Magazine
  • iScot IPTV Channel
  • Internet Radio Broadcast.

If we can reach £ 80,000 we can increase our reporting bandwidth to cover more events and issues throughout the country. 

  • £  80, 000 =
  • 3 x Monthly Digital/Printed Magazine
  • iScot IPTV Channel
  • Internet Radio Broadcast
  • Daily iScot IPTV News Broadcast

If we can reach £ 150,000 we can increase the number of guaranteed issues for printed magazines therefore improve readership numbers in order to attract advertising revenue to become sustainable for the future. We will increase broadcast time and content in IPTV and Radio

  • £ 150,000 =
  • 6 x Monthly Digital/Printed Magazine,
  • iScot IPTV Channel
  • Internet Radio Broadcast
  • Daily iScot IPTV News Broadcast 


Risks & Challenges

The success of the project rests on the level of investment and support from stakeholders who share our desire to see a free and transparent media, based in Scotland, controlled and promoted by Scots, for Scots. 

As Scotland undergoes a period of change the media landscape will evolve. We have set out a series of funding stages which will enable us to deliver a realistic plan to provide unbiased news and information to the public. 


Other Ways You Can Help

To provide a national news service requires more than money. We wish to reflect the views of the people across the country and report on events as they happen and wherever they take place.  iScot would welcome contribution of content for consideration and possible publication

story:
Short Summary

Little Do You Know is a novel about a college student named Hadley who is struggling to reconcile her uncertainties about her future, her mental health, and the relationships in her life. She had to learn to open up about her struggles in order to truly confront them.

My name is Iman Lavery and I am the author of Little Do You Know. I wrote this book because I have struggled with feeling the need to always seem put together, even when I’m not. I wanted to explore that need within myself and in the bigger context of young adulthood.

In this book, Hadley is a rising junior in college. Going into the summer after her sophomore year, she thinks she has it all figured out. She knows what she wants her career path to be, and even has an internship at her dream company. But over the summer, things start to fall apart and she realizes that she’s not as sure about things as she thought. The novel moves between two timelines: over the summer at her internship, and the following fall semester as she’s trying to pick up the pieces. She meets a boy over the summer, but her own insecurities and inability to confront her own problems threaten this budding relationship, as well as the other relationships in her life.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the universality of this struggle. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to facilitate the conversation about perfectionism and mental health in your own life.

You will love this book if you know what it’s like to hurt on the inside but hide it from the world, struggle to be open with the people closest to you, or are interested in navigating the confusing and difficult transition period of young adulthood.

Little Do You Know speaks to young people and all those working to find a balance with perfectionism and mental health in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that Little Do You Know inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • What does it mean to be honest with ourselves and others with things we’re struggling with?
  • How can we strengthen ourselves and our community by being open?
  • How do society-driven urges to always look perfect affect mental health and personal relationships?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing perfectionism, vulnerability, and mental health will change us all for the better.

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this spring.
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About the Author

Iman Lavery is a junior at Harvard College studying English with a minor in Film & Visual Studies.

By writing this book, Iman wanted to interrogate the need to be seen as perfect, especially among young adults, and the implications such a need can have on relationships and mental health. Having struggled against such impulses herself, she wanted to open up the conversation about the importance of being vulnerable and comfortable with making mistakes.

In her free time, Iman spends too much time watching movies and bad reality television. She is an amateur baker with a soft spot for chocolate cake recipes.

For more information, you can connect with Iman at imanlavery@gmail.com, on Instagram @iman.lavery, and on Twitter @iman_lavery.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #LittleDoYouKnow and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Iman

story:
Story of My Book

Exceptionally Average: Through Their Eyes is exploring how you can combine your personal passions and professional aspirations to build a fulfilling career.

My name is Tian Shi and I am the author of Exceptionally Average: Through Their Eyes. I wrote this book because I wanted to explore how founders used entrepreneurship to build achieve their goals to guide my own soul-searching process. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will be inspired. I want to show you that anyone can cause a ripple of change within their own community. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for entrepreneurship. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you discover your own potential by creating your own path and remaining steadfast to your core values and beliefs.

In this book, you'll learn about what it means to be a servant leader and how to leverage your assets and passions to positively benefit your community. You'll hear stories from...

  • Eric Woods, who left Wall Street to pursue a career in entrepreneurship to benefit his local home community with services that were not present previously.
  • Yossuf Albanawi, who used his personal struggles to found a company to prevent the opioid epidemic across the United States.

You will love this book if you want to learn how others achieved their vocational goals, want to explore what the entrepreneurship industry has to offer, or are just searching for a career that truly fulfills your passion.

Exceptionally Average: Through Their Eyes is a nonfiction book that speaks to college students and young professionals who want to look at how to manifest their ideas into a reality and want to embark on their career in a non-traditional way.
 

The Book - Exceptionally Average: Through Their Eyes


The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-3. We’ll learn why serving others is so powerful and ever so important in this day and age where we are all so individually focused. Why is it that if you find a $20 bill, you’ll find more fulfillment spending it on someone else than yourself? And yet, with the rise of social media and individualism, we as a society are becoming more divided and less united. How far will a single act of kindness take you?

Part 2 contains chapters 4-10. We will learn the seven pillars of servant leadership through stories from seventeen entrepreneurs and their lived experiences. Explore how you can create generational wealth through Jervonte’s Edmonds story and how to tackle ingrained social inequalities from Joy Buolamwini’s experience.

Part 3 contains chapters 11-14. We’ll learn how to become a servant leader from nine entrepreneurs. These four chapters investigate how to cultivate leadership in high school, college, as a recent graduate, and how to leverage the support from your immediate network to aid your own journey as an entrepreneur. Hear about Shaun Johnson’s two-decade-long journey to discover his entrepreneurial traits and how others, like Khuram Zuman, discovered his innovative nature at a young age. 
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Tian Shi is a student at Georgetown University, studying Biology, Cognitive Science, and Entrepreneurship. She is a mentor, teacher, and intern for a biotechnological startup.

She wrote this book because she wanted to explore how to embark on the non-traditional career path of becoming an entrepreneur to better others. She is curious to explore careers outside of the corporate, 9-5 lifestyle after she graduates college. She took it upon herself to understand the world of innovation in order to make a name for herself and inspire others to do the same.

In her spare time, she likes to explore the city that she’s living in by going for long runs. She likes to cook—pesto pizza with mozzarella is her favorite—paint, draw, and listen to podcasts that she comes across on Spotify, like Daily Ted Talks and Michelle Obama’s podcast.

For more information, you can connect with Tian at ttshi123@gmail.com and at @nait.shi on Instagram.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #throughtheireyes and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Tian Shi

story:
Story of My Book

Toffy’s Divide is a story set in a pseudo-dystopian society in the year 2049. It focuses on a young, intelligent, corporate professional trying to manage his place in society while staying true to himself. Toffy is haunted by the utilization bar at work, because if it falls below 100 percent, he might join the drone of people rendered useless by automation.

My name is Nifemi Aluko and I am the author of Toffy’s Divide. I wrote this book because I needed a story for a musical project I was working on in 2016. This took me down a 5-year journey to tell a story about transforming our personal realities in a constantly-evolving technological world.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the inner strength we all have to forge our own paths. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to escape from conformity and meaningless routine as you learn alongside Toffy and the other characters about the importance of telling our own stories through courage, empathy, and embracing self-awareness. 

 

The Book - Toffy's Divide

The utilization bar haunts Toffy, a high-rising engineer at the biggest technology corporation in the world. The pressure to reach and stay at 100% utilization never lets up. The space to do anything besides work is elusive. Finally Toffy goes against the norms of J Enterprise's conformist traditional order and breaks away from the shackles of continuous increase in productivity to write his own story. In this world, set in 2049, Toffy has to fight numerous forces but none more formidable than his experienced boss, James, owner of J Enterprise.

The external forces that Toffy is up against come in the form of non-stop distraction from the screens which are plastered all over J City - demanding the constant attention of its residents, his job that demands all his time, and colleagues who are constantly competing to raise their status in the clearly-defined socio-economic order that splits J City into High and Low Town. 

Triggered by a life-changing event, Toffy goes on a quest to write his story after signing up for a covert project with his friend Musta. Scribbling in his notebook whenever he can get away from the invasive screens, he fights to tell his story and assert his individuality.

Motivated and guided by his loved uncle - Apo - who inspires him along his journey with the storyteller’s secrets, Toffy navigates the thin line between High and Low Town while managing his responsibilities at work and his relationship with Dejah, who’s a beloved star at the social enterprise arm of J Enterprise.

But Toffy has to work against the world he and his colleagues have built where only one form of narrative is supported, dissent is met with immediate social punishment, people are rendered useless by increased automation, history is constantly revised by those that hold the pen, and James and his councilmen are on a quest to shore up more power. 

At the height of his professional success, Toffy can lose it all with every word he writes in his notebook and every sentence that makes him question the society he lives in. Every rhyme scheme and paragraph he adds takes him away from the tasks that are keeping him gainfully employed. He knows how easy it is to fall to the bottom of the order but even more intimidating is the climb back up. 

Will Toffy survive his decisions? Will he get his story out?

 

Who's Toffy's Divide For?

This book is for people that love stories about self-discovery. It’s for professionals looking for motivation to follow their curiosity and act on their creative impulses. It’s for people that enjoy dystopian fiction and futuristic stories, and book lovers interested in what the world could possibly look like in the year 2049.

Toffy’s Divide speaks to corporate professionals, explorers, and futurists who want to grapple with proper utilization of their time and doing meaningful work in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that Toffy’s Divide inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • What is the importance of developing self-awareness, staying true to one’s truly rich inner being, and finding your unique voice to tell your own story?
  • How do we deal with the struggle between maintaining the status quo for acceptance and having the courage to break away to find purpose?
  • What is the possible implication from our continuous advancements in technology and how it affects the everyday person in a world with growing inequality, capitalism, and consolidated power?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing purpose, self-growth, empathy, and curiosity will change us all for the better. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this fall 2021


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Nifemi Aluko is the Founder and CEO of kpakpakpa Inc - an information and advisory company that assists business builders with enterprise expansion across the African continent. 

Nifemi’s passion for music and making things drove him to write this book. What started as a music project (a mixtape) in 2016, took him down the path to begin writing Toffy’s story. This in turn led him to writing and publishing his first book, Press Play: Music As A Catalyst For Change. He took his learnings from publishing Press Play to close the creative loop by returning to the beginning to finish his novel and the musical project that started the entire journey. He’s looking forward to the impact that the book could have on fellow adventurers, tinkerers, explorers, and professionals seeking to follow their different creative interests like himself.

Almost 90% of the music Nifemi makes does not see the day of light (buried in the hard-drives of his laptops). Making music is a hobby, a form of therapy, and the gateway to developing a creative practice. He’s interested in so many things - technology, business, music, sports, storytelling - that he hears “Nifemi, so where’s your focus these days?” quite often.

For more information, you can connect with Nifemi at nifemi@kpakpakpa.com, on Instagram (@toffysdivide) and on LinkedIn (Nifemi Aluko).

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #ToffysDivide and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Nifemi Aluko

story:
Short Summary 

My name is Devyn Bakewell, and I am a novelist and the author of “Greater Life”. This novel is the sequel to my first novel, “Greater Love”, which has been by-far the greatest accomplishment of my life. Through the story of my main character, Ryan McKnight, I have been able to touch so many people, as well as give on point of view to the many stories of young black people, today. However, even with the success of my first novel, I don’t believe Ryan nor her boyfriend, Devyn Baker’s, story is over. They’ve started separate themselves from their hometown, Garden Heights, California, but their story at the historically black college, Truth University, has just begun. “Greater Life” goes into the world of these two love interest, putting not only their lives, but their relationship, to new test. Will they be able to survive? And just how far will they go to get there? Falling love is the easy part. It’s staying in love where things get hard. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover some of yourself in my characters as well as the experiences in this novel. Why do people tend to see black lives in such small lenses? I want you to see this book as an opportunity to engage with the diversity of the black community, specifically young black communities. We have stories to tell and inspiration to spread! 

Being an author has been my dream for as long as I can remember, and your support allows me to continue achieving my dreams. By helping my raise the money to get my second novel published, you are helping me finish Ryan and Devyn’s story. This not only leads to future books and new characters for us all to love, but put a hat on the lessons and memories that the characters of “Greater Love” brought about in many people—old and young. 

Message for All: 

This book is for anyone who is looking to find themselves, or wants to reminisce on the times when they were. You will enjoy this book if you are a fan of "Greater Love", a young black person, an HBCU student, or attending college. You will enjoy this book if you love romance, and want to read about black love, and you will enjoy this book if you're in a committed, long-term relationship. 

There is something in this book for everyone! "Greater Life" speaks to adults and students everywhere who want to experience a different perspective on growing up and falling in love. 

What We Need & What You'll Get 

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Winter.
  • I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About The Author 

Devyn Bakewell has a natural drive for equality and making a difference in the lives of others. She has worked toward her BA degree in English and minor degree in African studies at Howard University and continues to be an advocate for change based on this experience. She is known for her activist stances, collaboration with youths, and her work to promote awareness for the black community.

Devyn is passionate about creating unity through the sharing stories and by using similar experiences as a way to feel connected and encouraged. She continuously fights to change the plight of black youth and women and strives to transform that story line for the better.

International Preorders

Click here to make an International order. For international preorders, please do the following:

Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks

Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)

Use this form to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help 

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!

I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

  • At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit)
  • Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
  • When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry! 
  • Please use #GreaterLifeNovel and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!

Tag: 
Instragram - @dgirl2221/ @greaterlovenovel/ @newdegreepress
Facebook - @DevynBakewell / @NewDegreePress 
Twitter - @dgirl2221 / @NewDegreePress

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Bests,
Devyn Bakewell

story:
Story of My Book

From Harvard to Homeless narrates my introduction to vanlife and safe parking lots as a way to explore alternative housing options. By explaining the reasons why I chose to live inside my car, this book discusses the importance of policy making that help people find ways to find jobs, pay off student loans, as well as have the time, energy, and resources to visit the diverse geographies of the world ranging from cities, suburbs, and rural areas.


My name is Franklin Sooho Lee and I am the author of From Harvard to Homeless. I wrote this book because I felt that my experiences prior to current as a vanliver resonated with the people who supported me throughout my journey — from start to finish. The book was a way to take the deep conversations I had throughout my journey and organize them into a comprehensive format.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how to explore alternative housing options that fulfill your goals. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to reflect on why you live the way you currently do. I want you to ask: “Where would I live if I had no worry in the world? What job opportunities could I pursue if I if I could move to any city/state in the near future? If I could cut my current rent price in half, where would I spend the extra money?”

You will love this book if you are:

  • seeking alternative housing options to live in cities at a reasonable price. Vanlife is particularly attractive for geographical and financial mobility. It may be interesting to note that, with the current pandemic, vanlife business has been booming, which you can read more about in a recent New York Times article, "The #Vanlife Business is Booming."

  • a libertarians seeking to create a society where individuals are in the ideal environment to self-actualize and fulfill their deepest potential.

  • someone within the LGBQTI+ community who empathizes with the ongoing struggles of being part of a sexual minority. While our society has progressed immensely, the issue persists. The depiction that “Coming Out” is no longer an issue, I think, is a myth.

From Harvard to Homeless speaks to people struggling to pay for rent, student loans, and other everyday financial obligations. The book also speaks to young adults who are finding it difficult to move forward with their lives due to challenges in finding a job, moving into a new city for opportunities, and/or struggling to pave a road of independence from your parents/guardians. This book is, ultimately, intended for those who want to grapple with how we might define freedom and liberty in the upcoming decade as we discuss how we might envision economic and geographical mobility.

Ultimately, I hope that From Harvard to Homeless inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • How was I in the position to pursue vanlife? Did it come from a position of privilege or need?
  • How easily can people in our community pursue vanlife? Could people benefit from having vanlife as well as alternative housing options? If so, how could we make such options viable for our community?
  • Why have vanlife, tiny homes, and minimalism become popular in our society?

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing homelessness and LBGQTI+ youth, policy related to affordable housing and zoning laws, and student loans as it relates to geographical and economic mobility will change us all for the better.
 

From Harvard to Homeless

THE BOOK IS DIVIDED INTO THREE [3] PARTS:

Part One [1] , which includes the Introduction as well as Chapters 1 and 2, is intended for those of you who are interested in understanding my back story and want the context of my decisions to pursue vanlife.

In the first chapter, I write about how homelessness can happen to anyone, whether it be a Harvard graduate or a steady breadwinner of a family (or both!). More importantly, I write about my experience coming out to my parents and getting disowned, as homelessness rates are higher especially among LGBQTI+ minors. In fact, LGBTQI+ minors are 120% more likely to be homeless; and, currently, 40% of homeless youth are actually LGBTQI+ minors.

In the second chapter, I discuss about the concept of privilege in choosing to pursue vanlife. Arguably, everyone has a choice in their life; however, not all choices suggest the same level of freedom. As a Harvard graduate who experienced homelessness — albeit one night -- I discuss how societal support for vanlife can raise the level of freedom for individuals for who need it much more than I did.

Part Two [2], which includes Chapters 3 and 4, is intended for those who wish to rethink alternative housing options and learn the gritty details involved in planning and pursuing vanlife.

In the third chapter, I cover the complications of defining the homeless and how the complication is an added barrier to pursuing vanlife. For one, based on how definition the Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) defines someone who is homeless, it impacts who gets aid. However, the more important perspective is in regards to stigma as I question how myself and other individuals may see other homeless people.

In the fourth chapter, arguably the chapter that focuses on narrating my vanlife journey in more detail. The chapter works through a timeline in a diary format of my adventures. This chapter covers the various challenges in eventually pursuing vanlife, starting from getting a car loan, driving on the highway the first time, finding a place to park, and lots more!

Part Three [3], which includes Chapter 5 and 6, is intended for people who are visionaries interested in the bigger picture of my vanlife project.

In the fifth chapter, I cover safe parking lots in California as a way to show the most recent development of lots designed for people living inside their car out of need. In discussing the need and growing demand for such parking lots, I make the case that we should consider creating markets that supply such areas for cheap to replace rent.

In the sixth, and last, chapter, I reflect on my journey as a way to consider how my voice might amplify the needs of our community. I discuss how, unlike many vanlivers, I came with no fantasy nor expertise to fuel me. My project started from a combination or privilege and need. This concluding chapter accepts that I “truly stood on the shoulders of giants” and that I hope that I might be able to create a ladder for others to also see the great view from above!
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in [December, 2020]
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this [Winter 2020]

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Franklin Sooho Lee is a Research Assistant at R Street Institute looking for ways to impact policy so that individuals can thrive by exploring their curiosities. After graduating from Harvard in 2015 and pursuing his Master’s at Georgetown, Franklin accumulated nearly $100K in student loans. In contemplating ways to pave his road toward a brighter future, Franklin decided to pursue vanlife as a way to find economic and geographical mobility. Today, he believes that From Harvard to Homeless has the potential to bring about economic and geographical freedom to those who need it most. Ironically, Franklin consider himself a bad driver — having failed the driving test three times prior to getting his license. Franklin also wishes that he was more active and adventurous, as he sees himself as a homebody seeking comfort and security.

For more information you can connect with Franklin at
franklin.sooho.lee@post.harvard.edu and @frankeellins (Instagram/Twitter).

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #Harvard2Homeless and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Franklin Sooho Lee
story_txt:
Story of My BookFrom Harvard to Homeless narrates my introduction to vanlife and safe parking lots as a way to explore alternative housing options. By explaining the reasons why I chose to live inside my car, this book discusses the importance of policy making that help people find ways to find jobs, pay off student loans, as well as have the time, energy, and resources to visit the diverse geographies of the world ranging from cities, suburbs, and rural areas.My name is Franklin Sooho Lee and I am the author of From Harvard to Homeless. I wrote this book because I felt that my experiences prior to current as a vanliver resonated with the people who supported me throughout my journey — from start to finish. The book was a way to take the deep conversations I had throughout my journey and organize them into a comprehensive format.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how to explore alternative housing options that fulfill your goals. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to reflect on why you live the way you currently do. I want you to ask: “Where would I live if I had no worry in the world? What job opportunities could I pursue if I if I could move to any city/state in the near future? If I could cut my current rent price in half, where would I spend the extra money?”You will love this book if you are:
seeking alternative housing options to live in cities at a reasonable price. Vanlife is particularly attractive for geographical and financial mobility. It may be interesting to note that, with the current pandemic, vanlife business has been booming, which you can read more about in a recent New York Times article, "The #Vanlife Business is Booming."
a libertarians seeking to create a society where individuals are in the ideal environment to self-actualize and fulfill their deepest potential.
someone within the LGBQTI+ community who empathizes with the ongoing struggles of being part of a sexual minority. While our society has progressed immensely, the issue persists. The depiction that “Coming Out” is no longer an issue, I think, is a myth.
From Harvard to Homeless speaks to people struggling to pay for rent, student loans, and other everyday financial obligations. The book also speaks to young adults who are finding it difficult to move forward with their lives due to challenges in finding a job, moving into a new city for opportunities, and/or struggling to pave a road of independence from your parents/guardians. This book is, ultimately, intended for those who want to grapple with how we might define freedom and liberty in the upcoming decade as we discuss how we might envision economic and geographical mobility.Ultimately, I hope that From Harvard to Homeless inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:
How was I in the position to pursue vanlife? Did it come from a position of privilege or need?
How easily can people in our community pursue vanlife? Could people benefit from having vanlife as well as alternative housing options? If so, how could we make such options viable for our community?
Why have vanlife, tiny homes, and minimalism become popular in our society?

story:
Short Summary

My new book Victory Through Surrender came out of my personal struggle to understand how to live a life surrendered to the Lord Jesus Christ.  I share a little of my story and the resources God gave me to answer the question, "How does this work?"

The book, in two volumes, provides a daily how-to guide for living the surrendered life.  Insights from believers down through the centuries are shared through excerpts and adaptations of their works, and in poems and hymns in poem form (anthology-style).  There are model Scriptural confessions that I composed that are offered as examples of how to turn Bible passages into spoken confessions of faith.  Pages are provided each week for recording your notes and insights.  Both the devotional and the journaling aspects are included in this workbook format.

What We Need & What You Get

This campaign hopes to raise $7,000 for publishing and marketing of the books: $3,000 to publish the first volume, $2,000 to publish the second volume, and $2,000 for marketing, internet presence, and purchasing copies for direct sales.

  • For a contribution of $15, you will receive a digital copy of Volume One and Two.  
  • For a contribution of $30, you will receive digital copies and a signed copy of Volume One.  
  • For a contribution of $50, you will receive digital copies and signed copies of Volume One and Two.

The Impact

The content is complete and ready to go!  I believe this was an assignment from the Lord to bless the Church and help struggling believers learn how to get victory in their everyday lives.  This book will be published.  The timeframe is dependent on the funding, hence this crowdfunding campaign.  If you have had the same struggles or know someone who is going through difficulties now, I hope you will invest in this project and speed up the release of the book.  Click this link for a preview copy of the book.  The preview includes the Introduction, two weeks of content, and the Index of Authors from both volumes.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/b8qb1v4d9rd0m83/Fundr...

Half of the revenue generated by future book sales has been dedicated to five missional organizations who share the calling to spread the Gospel message to a needy world.

Other Ways You Can Help

The main platform for social media promotion will be through Facebook.  Please follow me on Facebook and share posts with your networks as they come out.  As a contributor, you will have access to the book preview and ultimately a copy of the book either in digital or published format, so you can add a recommendation to the shared posts, if you like.  Your help will be much appreciated.

story:
This pre-sale is now complete. Uplift and Empower is published! You can learn more about the book and order your copy at the book's website: upliftandempower.com

Story of My Book

 

Uplift and Empower is a guide to understanding extreme poverty for people who have never considered the topic before. Every day, over 600 million people around the globe live on less than $2 a day. Humanity is closer than it has ever been before to bringing that number down to zero, but the efforts and changes required to accomplish that goal start with all of us educating ourselves.

My name is Danielle Hawa Tarigha and I am the author of Uplift and Empower. I wrote this book because I was curious about why there weren’t obvious answers and solutions to questions surrounding poverty alleviation despite the hundreds of years and billions of dollars spent trying to address this problem.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that the answers to poverty’s questions aren’t as simple as they seem on the surface and, more importantly, you will learn how and why to make a difference with the information and answers that are available.

I would like to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for eradicating extreme poverty in you. And then, ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you reduce the poverty in your area—shifting away from simply giving money and donating without research and shifting towards more long-term, meaningful efforts.

In this book, you'll learn about topics such as the role of psychology in poverty alleviation and how the industrial revolution shaped modern social structures. I will also share stories about:

 

  • Why empowering women both in and outside of the household is a critical component to poverty alleviation
  • How China’s precision poverty alleviation efforts have had such unprecedented success in the 21st century
  • What job creation and training will look like in years to come and how new ideas about work will impact the extreme poor

 

You will love this book if you enjoy asking big questions, love subjects like history and economics, and are hopeful about the future of humanity.

Uplift and Empower is a non-fiction book that speaks to anyone who is curious about extreme poverty and poverty alleviation.

 

The Book - Uplift and Empower

 

The book is written in 4 Parts after the introduction and first chapter....

Part 1 covers the history of foreign aid along with the four industrial revolutions, an introduction to poverty theory, a discussion on comparative politics, and an overview of different types of giving. This section provides the history and context necessary for understanding how extreme poverty still persists today and helps answer questions like: Why can’t we just give low-income populations free money? How can I give in a sustainable way? And, what makes a country rich (or poor)?

Part 2 provides a deep dive into the psychology of poverty, (what I describe as “the poverty mindset”), explains why women’s empowerment needs to be a priority to move forward, discusses the impact of overpopulation and immigration, and includes two case studies on countries with quite different relationships to poverty: China and Liberia. In this section, expect to find answers to questions such as: How does living in poverty influence decision making? Why do women in low-income countries take jobs in dangerous conditions? And, what is causing the rate of global population growth to change?

Part 3 contains the building blocks for future solutions. The section offers a simplified approach to problem-solving as a framework for future solutions, addresses how the 21st-century job market can either help or hurt those living in extreme poverty, and attempts to find a middle ground between profit and poverty alleviation work. This section discusses questions like: What would universal basic income look like in practice? Why have young people’s attitudes towards work changed? And, are higher-income populations obligated to help lower-income populations?

Part 4 is the final chapter. In it, I address what poverty alleviation effort looks like from a day-to-day, individual-to-individual perspective. After providing the necessary context and background to understand extreme poverty, in part four you will learn how to help.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

 

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

 

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, E-book Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer.

 

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish my book as an e-book and share physical, softcover copies. At 150 pre-sales, I will also publish an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish along with...

  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering
  • Your name in a Special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Book introduction and the opportunity to review and provide feedback on an early copy of my manuscript
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my book cover
  • An invitation to a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

 

Danielle Hawa Tarigha is a fourth-year student at the University of Chicago studying economics. With internship experience in investment banking, public policy, information technology, and asset management, writing about global poverty alleviation was far from the subjects that she felt most familiar with; yet her lack of experience in the area is exactly why she wrote the book.

Danielle sought out to answer the questions of people who want to make a difference but don’t know where to start. She decided that the questions she had about extreme poverty likely weren’t unique and wanted to answer them in a straight-forward way because educating others about extreme poverty is a key component of eradicating it. Outside of her writing and research, Danielle likes to pursue her passion for fashion on Instagram.

For more information, you can connect with Danielle via email at danielle.tarigha@gmail.com and on Social Media — Twitter: @danielle_hawa Instagram: @danielle__hawa).

 

Risks & Challenges

 

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and ultimately publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. When you do, please use #UpliftandEmpower and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can amplify your efforts!

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it as a text message or Direct Message on social media to spread the word if you are willing.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!



Thanks again,

Danielle Hawa Tarigha
